ingredients: *_Okra and Tomato Stew with Caramelized Onions_*

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. Begin by preparing the okra. Wash and dry the okra pods, then trim off the tops and tails. Cut the okra into 1 inch pieces and set aside.
2. In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the onions and cook until they are caramelized, about 10-12 minutes. Stir occasionally to prevent burning.
3. Once the onions are caramelized, add the minced garlic and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
4. Add the okra to the pot and stir to combine with the onions and garlic. Cook for 5-7 minutes, until the okra begins to soften.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 5. Add the tomatoes to the pot, along with the cumin, dried thyme, dried oregano, salt. Stir to combine all the ingredients.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 6. Pour in 1 cup of water and bring the stew to a boil. Once boiling, reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and let it simmer for 15-20 minutes.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 7. Check the stew occasionally and stir to prevent it from sticking to the bottom of the pot. If the stew is too thick, you can add more water as needed.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 8. Once the okra is tender and the stew has thickened, you can serve it hot, garnished with fresh parsley if desired.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: This is a delicious and hearty dish that is perfect for any season. The combination of the okra and tomatoes creates a flavorful base, while the caramelized onions add a touch of sweetness. Serve this stew for a satisfying meal.
*_Spicy Okra and Tomato Curry with Caramelized Onions_*

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: - tip of a teaspoon of cayenne pepper

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. Begin by washing and drying 500 grams of okra. Remove the tops and tips of the okra and cut them into 1-inch pieces.

2. Heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the okra and cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until they start to brown. Remove the okra from the pan and set aside.
3. In the same pan, add 2 large sliced onions and cook on low heat for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until they are caramelized.
4. While the onions are caramelizing, chop 400 grams of tomatoes into small pieces. Crush 2 cloves of garlic and grate 1 tablespoon of ginger.
5. Once the onions are caramelized, add the garlic and ginger to the pan and cook for 1-2 minutes.
6. Add the chopped tomatoes to the pan and cook for 5-7 minutes until they start to break down.
7. Add 1 teaspoon each of cumin, coriander, turmeric, and cayenne pepper to the pan and mix well.
8. Return the okra to the pan and stir everything together. Add salt to taste.
9. Cover the pan and let the curry simmer for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the okra is tender.
10. Once the okra is cooked, remove the lid and let the curry cook for an additional 5 minutes to thicken.
11. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve.
Enjoy the delicious and flavorful combination of spicy okra and sweet caramelized onions!ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹
*_Tomato and Okra Gumbo with SautÃ©ed Onions_*

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. Begin by preparing all the vegetables. Wash and cut the okra into 1-inch pieces, dice the tomatoes, and slice the onions.
2. In a large pot, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the sliced onions and sautÃ© for 3-4 minutes until they start to become translucent.
3. Add the diced tomatoes to the pot and stir. Let it cook for 5 minutes until the tomatoes start to break down and become sauce-like.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 4. Add the okra to the pot and season with salt, black pepper, garlic powder, dried thyme, dried oregano, and bay leaf. Stir to combine all the ingredients.
5. Pour the vegetable broth over the vegetables and bring the mixture to a boil. Once boiling, reduce the heat to medium and let it simmer for 20 minutes.

6. While the gumbo is simmering, prepare the sautÃ©ed onions. Heat the remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the remaining sliced onions and cook for 5-6 minutes until they are caramelized and golden brown.
7. Once the gumbo has finished simmering, remove the bay leaf and check for seasoning. Adjust if needed.
8. To serve, ladle the gumbo into bowls and top with the sautÃ©ed onions.
Enjoy your delicious , a hearty and flavorful dish that is perfect for any occasion.ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹

Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. Begin by heating olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add diced onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
2. Cut the okra into 1-inch pieces and add them to the pot. Cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
3. Add in the seasoning and stir until the okra is evenly coated.
4. Cut the tomatoes into small chunks and add them to the pot. Cook for an additional 5 minutes.
5. Cut the onion  into bite-sized pieces and add them to the pot. Cook.
6. Pour in the vegetable broth and stir well. Season with salt to taste.
7. Increase the heat to high and bring the mixture to a boil. Once boiling, reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
8. Serve hot, garnished with fresh parsley if desired.

This is a delicious and hearty meal. The combination of tender okra, juicy tomatoes, and flavorful seasoning, along with the savory onion, creates a dish that is bursting with flavor. Serve it as a main course or as a side dish to your favorite protein.
Enjoy the taste of this easy recipe!ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹
*_Okra and Tomato Pasta with Caramelized Onion and Garlic Sauce_*

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. Begin by cooking the pasta according to package instructions in a large pot of salted boiling water. Once cooked, drain and set aside.
2. While the pasta is cooking, prepare the okra by washing and trimming off the stems. Cut them into bite-sized pieces.
3. In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat. Add the okra and cook for 5-7 minutes until slightly tender. Set aside.
4. In the same skillet, add another tablespoon of olive oil and the sliced onions. Cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the onions are caramelized and golden brown.
5. Add the minced garlic to the skillet with the onions and cook for an additional 2 minutes.
6. Next, add the cherry tomatoes to the skillet and cook for 5 minutes until they start to burst and release their juices.
7. Season the onion and tomato mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
8. Add the cooked pasta and okra to the skillet and toss everything together until well combined.
9. Let the pasta cook for an additional 2-3 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
10. Serve the hot, garnished with some fresh herbs or grated parmesan cheese if desired.

ingredients: 1. In a large pot, combine the lentils and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and let simmer for 20 minutes. Drain and set aside.
2. In the same pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.

6. Serve hot, garnished with fresh parsley or cilantro, if desired.

7. Let the soup simmer on medium heat for about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally. If the soup becomes too thick, add more water or broth to achieve your desired consistency.
8. Finally, season with salt ğŸ§‚ to taste.
Your is now ready to be served. This hearty and flavorful soup is best enjoyed with a side of fufu or pounded yam.

ingredients: 1. In a medium saucepan, combine the groundnut butter, coconut milk, water, rolled oats, banana slices, honey, chia seeds, ground cinnamon, and vanilla extract. Stir well to combine.
2. Place the saucepan over medium heat and bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce heat to low and let the porridge simmer for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally.
3. While the porridge is simmering, preheat a small non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add the shredded coconut and toast for 2-3 minutes until golden brown. Set aside.
4. Once the porridge is cooked and thickened to your desired consistency, remove from heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
5. Transfer the porridge to a serving bowl and top with the toasted coconut.

_Enjoy your hot, or let it cool down and refrigerate for a yummy breakfast the next day. You can also add additional toppings such as fresh fruit, nuts, or a drizzle of extra honey for added sweetness._

*This creamy and delicious porridge bowl is a perfect blend of African and tropical flavors, making it a unique and flavorful breakfast option. The groundnut butter adds protein and healthy fats, while the coconut milk adds a rich and creamy texture. This recipe can be easily adjusted to your liking by adding more or less water depending on how thick you prefer your porridge. So next time you're craving a warm and comforting breakfast, give this a try!ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹*
*_Mango Coconut Overnight Oats with Vegan Yogurt_*

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. In a medium-sized bowl, mix together the rolled oats, coconut milk, and vegan yogurt until well combined.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 2. Add in the diced mango, chia seeds, and shredded coconut. Stir well to evenly distribute all the ingredients.
3. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap or transfer the mixture into an airtight container.
4. Place the bowl or container in the refrigerator and let the oats soak overnight, or for at least 6-8 hours.
5. In the morning, give the oats a quick stir. If the mixture is too thick, you can add more coconut milk or water to achieve your desired consistency.
6. Transfer the oat mixture into serving bowls or jars. Top with sliced almonds, extra diced mango, and a drizzle of honey (or maple syrup) for sweetness.
Enjoy your delicious and nutritious for a quick and easy breakfast or snack option.
- You can use any type of vegan yogurt for this recipe, such as almond or coconut yogurt.
- If you prefer a sweeter taste, you can add a bit more honey or maple syrup to the oats before soaking overnight.
- The chia seeds and shredded coconut add extra fiber and healthy fats, but you can omit them if desired.
- For a tropical twist, you can also add some diced pineapple or banana to the oats.
- This recipe can be easily doubled or tripled to make multiple servings for meal prep.
- You can also use frozen mango if fresh is not available, just make sure to let it thaw before adding it to the oat mixture.ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹

ingredients: 1. Preheat your oven to 375 degrees Celsius (190 degrees Celsius).
2. Cut the tops off the bell peppers and remove the seeds and membranes. Place them in a baking dish and set aside.
3. In a pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the diced onion and minced garlic, and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
4. Add the thawed spinach to the pan and cook until heated through, about 2 minutes.
5. In a separate bowl, mix together the ricotta cheese, dried oregano, dried basil, and salt and pepper.
6. Add the spinach mixture to the bowl with the ricotta cheese and mix well.
7. Stuff the mixture into the bell peppers, filling them evenly.
8. Place the stuffed peppers in the preheated oven and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the peppers are tender and the filling is heated through.
9. Serve hot as a delicious vegetarian meal for Father's Day, or any day!

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: One cup dried will yield about 4 cups cooked.
Vegetable broth: 4-5 cups is usually enough to submerge the lentils as they cook thoroughly.
Carrot, celery stalk, and medium onion.
These aromatic vegetables add a wonderful depth of flavor to the soup.
They also provide a hint of sweetness and freshness that balances out the earthiness of the lentils.
Tomato:  adding color to the lentil soup; use fresh chopped tomato, but tomato sauce or tomato paste can also work.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: Bay leaves: A common ingredient in Italian soups and stews. It adds a subtle herbal note and enhances the overall flavor of the soup.
Sea salt to taste: Season generously towards the end.
Extra virgin olive oil: For sautÃ©ing the soffritto and for the serving.
Drizzle some high-quality olive oil over the finished soup before serving.
Rinse the lentils thoroughly. This helps remove any impurities and ensures a clean taste.
In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add the diced onion, carrot, and celery, and sautÃ© until they soften.
Add the rinsed lentils, bay leaf, chopped tomato, and broth to the pot.
Bring to a boil, then let it simmer in a lower heat for about 30-40 minutes, or until the lentils are tender.
Once the lentils are cooked, remove the bay leaf and season the soup with salt.
Ladle the hot soup into bowls and finish with a drizzle of olive oil and fresh basil or parsley.
Serve as a main course with crusty bread or your favorite side dish.ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹
TOP TIPS FOR A DELICIOUS SOUP
Rinse dried lentils well before cooking to remove any dust or debris.
Lentil soup thickens as it sits â€“ add more broth as needed when reheating.
Use vegetable stock to make a vegetarian lentil soup.
Veggie power: Add more vegetables to the mix.
Zucchini, swiss chard, bell peppers, baby spinach, or fresh kale can be excellent additions to boost the nutritional value.
Creamy soup: If you prefer a creamier texture, blend a portion of the cooked soup using an immersion or regular blender.
Pour it back into the pot and stir to combine.
Add Pasta: Itâ€™s something nice to do with leftovers the next day.
Cook the pasta directly in the lentils, adding about 2 cups of water. Serve with a sprinkle of parmesan cheese.
*If you have leftovers or want to make a big batch of Italian lentil soup ahead of time, hereâ€™s how you can store it:*
Fridge: Allow the soup to cool completely before transferring it to an airtight container.
It will stay fresh in the refrigerator for 4-5 days.
Freeze: If you want to extend the soupâ€™s shelf life, freezing is the way to go.
Portion the soup into freezer-safe containers or resealable freezer bags, leaving some room for expansion. It can be frozen for three months.
Thaw in the refrigerator overnight before reheating.
*DO YOU SOAK THE LENTILS BEFORE COOKING?*
No, you donâ€™t need to soak the lentils before cooking.
*_Unlike some other legumes, lentils cook relatively quickly without pre-soaking. Just give them a good rinse before putting them in the pot._*
CAN I USE CANNED LENTILS INSTEAD OF DRY?
While dried lentils are preferred for their texture and flavor, you can certainly use canned lentils if youâ€™re short on time or like the convenience.
Drain and rinse the canned lentils before adding them to the soup. Remember that canned lentils are already cooked, so youâ€™re the cooking time to avoid overcooking them.
CAN I USE OTHER TYPES OF LENTILS?
Yes! While the recipe calls for dried lentils, you can experiment with different types, such as green lentils, brown, or black.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 2 Red tomatoes, or a can of tomatoes
4 cups of Vegetable broth as needed

4. Add the garam masala, cumin powder, turmeric powder, coriander leaves and salt to taste. Mix well.
5. Take the samosas and gently open each one up.
6. Stuff the samosas with the paneer mixture.
7. Heat another pan on medium-high heat and add some vegetable oil.
8. Fry the stuffed samosas until golden brown on both sides.
9. Serve hot with chutney of your choice.

*Paneer can be made with milk, goat milk, sheep milk or cow's milk. Although it is similar to cottage cheese, paneer is usually made without rennet and therefore has a different texture. Paneer is made by curdling milk with a food acid, usually lemon juice or vinegar.*

ingredients: 1. Wash the eggplant and cut into small cubes.
2. Heat some oil in a large pan over medium heat and add the eggplant cubes.
3. Cook the eggplant cubes for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally until they are lightly browned.
4. Crack the eggs into a bowl, whisk until combined and season with salt.
5. Add the eggs to the pan with the eggplant cubes and stir to combine.
6. Cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the eggs are cooked through.
7. Serve with a side of your favorite vegetables, or enjoy as is.
*_Stuffed Onions with Pumpkin and Tomato Filling_*

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 2. Cut off the tops and bottoms of the onions and peel off the outer skin.
3. Using a sharp knife, carefully slice off a small portion of one side of each onion, creating a flat surface to help them stand upright.
4. Scoop out the center of each onion, leaving about 1/2 inch of flesh around the sides and bottom.
5. In a large bowl, mix together the diced pumpkin, tomatoes, olive oil, salt, thyme, oregano, and garlic powder.
6. Stuff each onion with the pumpkin and tomato mixture, pressing down gently to make sure they are filled evenly.
7. Place the stuffed onions in a baking dish and cover with foil.
8. Bake for 30 minutes, then remove the foil and sprinkle parmesan cheese on top of each onion.
9. Bake for an additional 10-15 minutes, or until the onions are tender and the cheese is melted and golden brown.
10. Serve hot and enjoy your delicious meal ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹!

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. In a large pan, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat.
2. Add the diced onion and minced garlic to the pan and cook until the onion is translucent, about 3-4 minutes.
3. Add the diced pumpkin to the pan and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
4. Pour in the canned tomatoes and add the cumin. Stir to combine.
5. Season with salt to taste, then reduce the heat to medium-low and let the mixture simmer for 10 minutes.
6. Using a spoon, create four wells in the tomato and pumpkin mixture. Crack an egg into each well.
7. Cover the pan and let the eggs cook for 5-7 minutes, or until the whites are cooked but the yolks are still runny.
8. Once the eggs are cooked, remove the pan from the heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
9. Garnish with fresh parsley and serve hot.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: *_Enjoy your delicious meal! This hearty and flavorful dish is perfect for breakfast, brunch, or even a quick dinner. The combination of pumpkin and tomato creates a rich and creamy sauce that pairs perfectly with the perfectly cooked eggs. This dish is also a great way to sneak in some extra vegetables into your diet. Serve with crusty bread for dipping or over a bed of rice for a more filling meal._*

ingredients: 1. In a large pot, heat vegetable oil over medium heat. Add chopped onion, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped chili. Cook for 2-3 minutes until the onions are soft and translucent.
2. Add the cubed pumpkin and potatoes to the pot. Stir to combine with the onion mixture.
3. In a small bowl, mix together the curry powder, ground cumin, ground coriander, and turmeric. Sprinkle the spice mixture over the vegetables in the pot. Stir to coat the vegetables evenly.
4. Pour in the coconut milk and vegetable broth. Stir well and bring the curry to a simmer.

5. Allow the curry to cook for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the pumpkin and potatoes are soft and cooked through. If the curry becomes too thick, add a splash of water or more vegetable broth.
6. Taste the curry and add salt, if needed, to adjust the seasoning.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 7. Serve the pumpkin and potato curry over a bed of cooked basmati rice. Garnish with chopped fresh cilantro, if desired.

*Enjoy this flavorful and hearty as a delicious and satisfying meal. The creamy coconut milk and warm spices make this curry the perfect comfort food for a chilly evening. This recipe is also great for meal prepping and can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.*

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. Begin by washing the peas and setting them aside to drain. Then, dice the tomatoes and finely chop the onion.
2. In a large pan, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Once hot, add the cumin seeds and let them sizzle for a few seconds.
3. Add the chopped onion to the pan and cook until it becomes translucent, about 2-3 minutes.
4. Next, add the minced garlic and grated ginger to the pan. Cook for an additional minute, stirring constantly.
5. Add the diced tomatoes to the pan, along with the coriander powder, garam masala, turmeric powder, and red chili powder. Stir everything together and let it cook for 2-3 minutes.
6. Once the tomatoes have softened and started to release their juices, add the drained peas to the pan. Stir everything together and let it cook for 5-7 minutes, until the peas are tender.
7. If the curry is looking dry, you can add a splash of water to the pan to create some gravy. Let it cook for an additional 2-3 minutes.
8. Taste the curry and add salt to your liking.
9. Once the peas are fully cooked and the curry has reached your desired consistency, turn off the heat and let it sit for a few minutes.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 10. Serve the hot, garnished with fresh cilantro. This dish pairs well with steamed rice or other traditional dishes.
*Pea and Potato Curry with Tomato Chutney*

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. Start by preparing the tomato chutney. Roughly chop the tomatoes, onion, garlic, ginger, and green chili and put them in a food processor. Blend until smooth.
2. In a pan, heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil over medium heat. Add in the mustard seeds and cumin seeds and let them sizzle for a minute.
3. Add the blended tomato mixture to the pan and stir well. Season with red chili powder and salt to taste.
4. Let the chutney cook for about 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until it thickens and the oil starts to separate from the sides. Set aside.
5. In a separate pot, boil the potatoes until they are fork-tender. Drain and let them cool before peeling and cutting them into small cubes. Set aside.
6. In the same pot, add the peas and enough water to cover them. Bring to a boil and let them cook for 5 minutes. Drain and set aside.
7. In a large pan, heat 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil over medium heat. Add in the cumin seeds and let them sizzle for a minute.
8. Add in the finely chopped red onion, garlic, ginger, and green chili. Cook until the onions are soft and translucent.
9. Add in the coriander powder, turmeric powder, and red chili powder. Stir well.
10. Add in the boiled potatoes and peas to the pan. Mix everything

ingredients: 1. Begin by boiling a pot of water and cooking the pasta according to package instructions.
2. While the pasta is cooking, prepare the achali pepper and garlic. Remove the seeds from the pepper and slice it into thin strips. Peel and finely chop the garlic cloves.
3. In a pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the achali pepper strips and garlic and let them cook for 3-4 minutes, or until the garlic is fragrant.
4. Once the pasta is cooked, drain it and add it to the pan with the infused oil. Toss the pasta in the oil until it is evenly coated.
5. Season with a pinch of salt, to taste.
6. Serve the on plates and top with grated parmesan cheese. If desired, garnish with fresh parsley for added flavor and color.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: *_Mediterranean Quinoa Salad with Roasted Vegetables and Sanguages_*

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit (200 degrees Celsius).
2. In a small saucepan, combine the quinoa and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Fluff with a fork and set aside to cool.
3. In a large bowl, toss together the diced bell peppers, zucchini, eggplant, and red onion with 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Season with salt.
4. Spread the vegetables evenly on a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes, or until they are tender and lightly browned, stirring occasionally.
5. In a separate small bowl, whisk together the lemon juice, 1/4 cup of olive oil  to make the dressing.
6. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooled quinoa, roasted vegetables, Kalamata olives, crumbled feta cheese, chopped parsley, and chopped mint.
7. Pour the dressing over the quinoa and vegetables and toss to combine.
8. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving to allow the flavors to meld together.
9. Serve chilled and garnish with additional chopped fresh herbs if desired.
*_Grilled Veggie and Sanguage Stir-Fry Bowl with Tofu_*

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. Begin by preparing the vegetables. Cut the zucchinis into thick slices, deseed and slice the bell peppers, and slice the red onion. Peel and mince the garlic cloves.
2. Preheat your grill to medium-high heat. Meanwhile, drain the block of tofu and pat it dry with paper towels. Cut the tofu into bite-sized cubes.
3. In a small bowl, mix together the soy sauce, honey, ginger powder, and a pinch of salt.
4. In a large bowl, add the sliced vegetables and tofu. Pour the marinade over the vegetables and tofu, and gently toss to ensure everything is coated evenly.

5. Thread the vegetables and tofu onto skewers, alternating between them. If using wooden skewers, make sure to soak them in water for at least 30 minutes beforehand to prevent them from burning on the grill.
6. Grill the skewers for 10-12 minutes, turning occasionally, until the vegetables are slightly charred and the tofu is heated through.
7. While the skewers are grilling, heat a large wok or pan over medium-high heat. Add 2 tablespoons of olive oil and swirl to coat the pan.
8. Cut the sanguage sausages into bite-sized pieces and add them to the pan. Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until slightly browned.
9. Add the minced garlic to the pan and stir-fry for an additional minute.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 10. Add the cooked rice to the pan and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until heated through.
11. Once the skewers are done, remove them from the grill and slide the vegetables and tofu off the skewers into the stir-fry pan. Stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes until everything is well.
*_Coconut ğŸ¥¥ ğŸ¥¥ ğŸ¥¥ Curry Lentil Soup ğŸ²ğŸ²ğŸ²_*

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. In a large pot, heat vegetable oil over medium heat. Add diced onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
2. Add minced garlic, ginger, and curry powder to the pot. Cook for an additional 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
3. Pour in the can of coconut milk and vegetable broth. Stir to combine.
4. Add dried lentils. Bring the soup to a boil, then reduce the heat and let it simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the lentils are fully cooked and tender.
5. Season the soup with salt to taste.
6. Serve the soup hot, garnished with fresh cilantro and a squeeze of lime juice.
*_Mushroom ğŸ„ğŸ„ğŸ„ and Spinach â˜˜ï¸â˜˜ï¸â˜˜ï¸ Quinoa Risotto_*

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the diced onion and cook until translucent, about 3 minutes.
2. Add the minced garlic and sliced mushrooms to the pot. Cook for 5 minutes, until the mushrooms have softened.
3. Add the quinoa to the pot and stir to combine with the mushrooms. Toast the quinoa for 2-3 minutes, until it starts to lightly brown.
4. Slowly pour in the vegetable broth, stirring constantly. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for 15 minutes.
5. After 15 minutes, add the chopped spinach to the pot. Stir to combine and let it continue to cook for another 5 minutes.
6. Check the quinoa for doneness. If it is still slightly crunchy, add a little more vegetable broth and continue to cook for a few more minutes.
7. Once the quinoa is fully cooked and the liquid has been absorbed, remove the pot from the heat.
8. Stir in the grated Parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper, to taste.
9. Transfer the risotto to a serving dish and garnish with fresh parsley, if desired.

10. Serve hot and enjoy your delicious ! This dish is packed with protein, fiber, and nutrients from the quinoa, mushrooms, and spinach. It's a perfect vegetarian meal that is both healthy and satisfying.

Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. In a medium saucepan, combine the groundnut butter, coconut milk, water, rolled oats, banana slices, honey, chia seeds, ground cinnamon, and vanilla extract. Stir well to combine.
2. Place the saucepan over medium heat and bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce heat to low and let the porridge simmer for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally.
3. While the porridge is simmering, preheat a small non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add the shredded coconut and toast for 2-3 minutes until golden brown. Set aside.
4. Once the porridge is cooked and thickened to your desired consistency, remove from heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
5. Transfer the porridge to a serving bowl and top with the toasted coconut.

_Enjoy your hot, or let it cool down and refrigerate for a yummy breakfast the next day. You can also add additional toppings such as fresh fruit, nuts, or a drizzle of extra honey for added sweetness._

*This creamy and delicious porridge bowl is a perfect blend of African and tropical flavors, making it a unique and flavorful breakfast option. The groundnut butter adds protein and healthy fats, while the coconut milk adds a rich and creamy texture. This recipe can be easily adjusted to your liking by adding more or less water depending on how thick you prefer your porridge. So next time you're craving a warm and comforting breakfast, give this a try!ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹*
*_Mango Coconut Overnight Oats with Vegan Yogurt_*

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. In a medium-sized bowl, mix together the rolled oats, coconut milk, and vegan yogurt until well combined.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 2. Add in the diced mango, chia seeds, and shredded coconut. Stir well to evenly distribute all the ingredients.
3. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap or transfer the mixture into an airtight container.
4. Place the bowl or container in the refrigerator and let the oats soak overnight, or for at least 6-8 hours.
5. In the morning, give the oats a quick stir. If the mixture is too thick, you can add more coconut milk or water to achieve your desired consistency.
6. Transfer the oat mixture into serving bowls or jars. Top with sliced almonds, extra diced mango, and a drizzle of honey (or maple syrup) for sweetness.
Enjoy your delicious and nutritious for a quick and easy breakfast or snack option.
- You can use any type of vegan yogurt for this recipe, such as almond or coconut yogurt.
- If you prefer a sweeter taste, you can add a bit more honey or maple syrup to the oats before soaking overnight.
- The chia seeds and shredded coconut add extra fiber and healthy fats, but you can omit them if desired.
- For a tropical twist, you can also add some diced pineapple or banana to the oats.
- This recipe can be easily doubled or tripled to make multiple servings for meal prep.
- You can also use frozen mango if fresh is not available, just make sure to let it thaw before adding it to the oat mixture.ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹

*Tahini (/tÉ™ËˆhiËni, tÉ‘Ë-/) (Arabic: Ø·Ø­ÙŠÙ†Ø©, lit.â€‰'ground' (past participle of grind), or rashi (Arabic: Ø±Ø§Ø´ÙŠ) is a Middle-Eastern condiment made from ground sesame. Its more commonly eaten variety comes from hulled sesame, but unhulled seeds can also be used for preparing it. The latter variety has been described as slightly bitter, but more nutritious. ingredients: 1. In a large pot, heat vegetable oil over medium heat. Add diced onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
2. Add minced garlic, ginger, and curry powder to the pot. Cook for an additional 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
3. Pour in the can of coconut milk and vegetable broth. Stir to combine.
4. Add dried lentils. Bring the soup to a boil, then reduce the heat and let it simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the lentils are fully cooked and tender.
5. Season the soup with salt to taste.
6. Serve the soup hot, garnished with fresh cilantro and a squeeze of lime juice.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: One cup dried will yield about 4 cups cooked.
Vegetable broth: 4-5 cups is usually enough to submerge the lentils as they cook thoroughly.
Carrot, celery stalk, and medium onion.
These aromatic vegetables add a wonderful depth of flavor to the soup.
They also provide a hint of sweetness and freshness that balances out the earthiness of the lentils.
Tomato:  adding color to the lentil soup; use fresh chopped tomato, but tomato sauce or tomato paste can also work.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: Bay leaves: A common ingredient in Italian soups and stews. It adds a subtle herbal note and enhances the overall flavor of the soup.
Sea salt to taste: Season generously towards the end.
Extra virgin olive oil: For sautÃ©ing the soffritto and for the serving.
Drizzle some high-quality olive oil over the finished soup before serving.
Rinse the lentils thoroughly. This helps remove any impurities and ensures a clean taste.
In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add the diced onion, carrot, and celery, and sautÃ© until they soften.
Add the rinsed lentils, bay leaf, chopped tomato, and broth to the pot.
Bring to a boil, then let it simmer in a lower heat for about 30-40 minutes, or until the lentils are tender.
Once the lentils are cooked, remove the bay leaf and season the soup with salt.
Ladle the hot soup into bowls and finish with a drizzle of olive oil and fresh basil or parsley.
Serve as a main course with crusty bread or your favorite side dish.ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹
TOP TIPS FOR A DELICIOUS SOUP
Rinse dried lentils well before cooking to remove any dust or debris.
Lentil soup thickens as it sits â€“ add more broth as needed when reheating.
Use vegetable stock to make a vegetarian lentil soup.
Veggie power: Add more vegetables to the mix.
Zucchini, swiss chard, bell peppers, baby spinach, or fresh kale can be excellent additions to boost the nutritional value.
Creamy soup: If you prefer a creamier texture, blend a portion of the cooked soup using an immersion or regular blender.
Pour it back into the pot and stir to combine.
Add Pasta: Itâ€™s something nice to do with leftovers the next day.
Cook the pasta directly in the lentils, adding about 2 cups of water. Serve with a sprinkle of parmesan cheese.
*If you have leftovers or want to make a big batch of Italian lentil soup ahead of time, hereâ€™s how you can store it:*
Fridge: Allow the soup to cool completely before transferring it to an airtight container.
It will stay fresh in the refrigerator for 4-5 days.
Freeze: If you want to extend the soupâ€™s shelf life, freezing is the way to go.
Portion the soup into freezer-safe containers or resealable freezer bags, leaving some room for expansion. It can be frozen for three months.
Thaw in the refrigerator overnight before reheating.
*DO YOU SOAK THE LENTILS BEFORE COOKING?*
No, you donâ€™t need to soak the lentils before cooking.
*_Unlike some other legumes, lentils cook relatively quickly without pre-soaking. Just give them a good rinse before putting them in the pot._*
CAN I USE CANNED LENTILS INSTEAD OF DRY?
While dried lentils are preferred for their texture and flavor, you can certainly use canned lentils if youâ€™re short on time or like the convenience.
Drain and rinse the canned lentils before adding them to the soup. Remember that canned lentils are already cooked, so youâ€™re the cooking time to avoid overcooking them.
CAN I USE OTHER TYPES OF LENTILS?
Yes! While the recipe calls for dried lentils, you can experiment with different types, such as green lentils, brown, or black.

ingredients: 1. In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the diced onion and cook until translucent, about 3 minutes.
2. Add the minced garlic and sliced mushrooms to the pot. Cook for 5 minutes, until the mushrooms have softened.
3. Add the quinoa to the pot and stir to combine with the mushrooms. Toast the quinoa for 2-3 minutes, until it starts to lightly brown.
4. Slowly pour in the vegetable broth, stirring constantly. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for 15 minutes.
5. After 15 minutes, add the chopped spinach to the pot. Stir to combine and let it continue to cook for another 5 minutes.
6. Check the quinoa for doneness. If it is still slightly crunchy, add a little more vegetable broth and continue to cook for a few more minutes.
7. Once the quinoa is fully cooked and the liquid has been absorbed, remove the pot from the heat.
8. Stir in the grated Parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper, to taste.
9. Transfer the risotto to a serving dish and garnish with fresh parsley, if desired.

10. Serve hot and enjoy your delicious ! This dish is packed with protein, fiber, and nutrients from the quinoa, mushrooms, and spinach. It's a perfect vegetarian meal that is both healthy and satisfying.

ingredients: 1. Preheat your oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit (190 degrees Celsius).

5. Roll out the dough onto a parchment-lined baking sheet, creating a round pizza shape.
6. In a small saucepan, heat the minced garlic and vegan cream cheese over medium heat until the cream cheese is melted and the garlic is fragrant.
7. Spread the creamy garlic sauce over the pizza crust.
8. Top the pizza with the diced red onion, sliced mushrooms, black olives, and bell peppers.
9. Bake the pizza in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, until the crust is golden brown.
10. Once the pizza is done baking, remove it from the oven and top it with fresh basil and a sprinkle of salt and pepper.
11. Let the pizza cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

ingredients: 1. Preheat your oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit (200 degrees Celsius).

2. In a mixing bowl, combine the drained and pressed tofu, soy sauce, sesame oil, chili powder, garlic powder, onion powder, and ground ginger. Mix well until the tofu is evenly coated with the marinade.
3. Place the tofu on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and bake for 20 minutes, flipping halfway through.

4. While the tofu is baking, prepare the peanut sauce by combining the peanut butter, hoisin sauce, apple cider vinegar, and sriracha sauce in a small saucepan over low heat. Stir until the sauce is smooth and heated through.
5. Once the tofu is done baking, remove it from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
6. Spread the peanut sauce evenly over the pre-made pizza crust.
7. Cut the tofu into bite-sized pieces and evenly distribute them on top of the pizza.
8. Sprinkle the shredded carrots, chopped red bell pepper, green onions, and cilantro on top of the pizza.
9. Bake the pizza in the oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the crust is crispy and the vegetables are slightly roasted.
10. Once done, remove the pizza from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.
Enjoy your delicious and unique ! Optional: Drizzle with extra peanut sauce for added flavor.ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹

*What Is Tempeh (and How to Cook It)*
What is tempeh and how do you cook it? Here Iâ€™m sharing a guide to all things tempeh along with my favorite marinated tempeh recipe.
If youâ€™re new to tempeh, youâ€™re in the right place because I have created a guide to teach you all about tempeh, itâ€™s health benefits and how to cook it!

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: You may have seen some of my tempeh recipes and wondered what tempeh is. For starters, itâ€™s a plant-based protein made of cooked soybeans (think edamame) that have been fermented. The fermentation process binds the soybeans into a cake/patty, which is what youâ€™ll find at your local grocery store. Some varieties of tempeh only include soybeans, but others will contain grains like barley, rice, flax or millet along with the soybeans.

Tempeh on its own has a mild, nutty flavor thatâ€™s often described as earthy. Like most proteins, it really takes on the flavor of the dish! When prepared with marinades or sauces, it absorbs those flavors and the end result is so tasty.
Tempeh is related to tofu, but they arenâ€™t the same thing! They are both made from soy, but other than that theyâ€™re actually quite different.

Tempeh is less processed, fermented and has a stronger flavor and a bit more texture. Tofu is more processed and has a milder flavor with basically no texture! Tofu can be blended up into a creamy sauce or soup or can be fried for more texture, but in general it is much smoother than tempeh.

I also find tempeh a bit easier to work with because thereâ€™s minimal prep work. With tofu you have to account for extra time to press it and with tempeh you simply open the package and youâ€™re ready to chop and cook!
Side by side tempeh rectangles. On the left, the tempeh is out of the packaging, on the right is Lightlife tempeh in the packaging.

Iâ€™ve tried a ton of different tempeh varieties and Lightlife is definitely my favorite for a few reasons: itâ€™s organic, GMO-free and easy to find in mainstream stores. I gravitate towards the Three Grain variety because it is the mildest in terms of taste, but I like the original as well!
You can buy tempeh in most major grocery stores and at every health food store. Youâ€™ll find it in the refrigerated section, usually by the produce or other plant-based proteins.
A square of tempeh that has been sliced into long, thin sections.
Tempeh is incredibly healthy! Not only is it a complete protein, but itâ€™s a good source of iron, prebiotics, B vitamins and manganese. A 1 cup serving of tempeh has a whopping 31 grams of protein!!

As I mentioned above, tempeh is a fermented food. This fermentation process breaks down phytic acid, which can inhibit mineral absorption. This means the minerals in tempeh are easier to digest and tempeh is also less likely to cause gas or indigestion when compared to other beans. I donâ€™t know about you, but less gas and bloating is always a win in my book!
Three versions of tempeh that have been sliced, cubed, and cut into triangles.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: There are so many different ways to cut tempeh, but here are my go-to methods:

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: Thin slices: if Iâ€™m using tempeh to make my tempeh bacon, blackened tempeh salad or vegan breakfast sandwich I like to cut the tempeh into 1/4â€ thick strips/slices.

Cubes or triangles: if the tempeh is the star of the recipe like in this vegan sweet and sour or tempeh butternut squash bake I like to cut it into cubes or triangles. For cubes, just try to keep cut them into the same sized cubes so they cook evenly. To cut tempeh into triangles, cut the tempeh in half width-wise. Cut each half in a star pattern to get 16 mini triangles per package of tempeh, 32 triangles total.

Crumbled: crumbled tempeh is a great substitute for recipes that typically have ground meat like these tempeh tacos or this tempeh bolognese sauce. To crumble tempeh, simply break it apart with your hands until you reach a desired consistency, similar to that of ground meat.
A close up of tempeh triangles marinating in a maple balsamic glaze.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: Packaged tempeh is pre-cooked so you can easily enjoy it right from the package (on sandwiches, salads, etc), but I highly recommend cooking it so that it tastes better.

A lot of people suggest steaming the tempeh before marinating or cooking to help remove any bitterness. I honestly donâ€™t take the time to do this, but if youâ€™d like to try it hereâ€™s the process. To steam the tempeh, cut it as desired, place in a steamer basket, cover and steam for 10-15 minutes. If you donâ€™t have a steamer basket, you can fill a saucepan with 1-2 inches of water and bring it to a boil. Once boiling place the tempeh in the saucepan, cover and reduce heat to a simmer and cook for 10-15 minutes.

My favorite way to make tempeh taste amazing is to marinate it! You can marinate in the fridge anywhere from one hour to overnight. The longer it marinates the longer the tempeh has time to soak up all the flavors. Iâ€™m sharing a simple tempeh marinade below made of maple syrup, balsamic vinegar, oil, tamari and garlic. Itâ€™s a staple recipe in our house!
Once your tempeh is prepped and marinated, itâ€™s time to cook it! You have a few options. Hereâ€™s what I recommend:
Pan sautÃ© â€“ I typically sautÃ© my tempeh. Heat 1 Tablespoon of oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the tempeh and cook until golden brown, about 4-5 minutes per side.

Bake â€“ Baking tempeh is a great hands-off cooking option! Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a silicone mat. Spread the tempeh evenly and bake at 400ÂºF for about 25 minutes or until golden brown.

Air fry â€“ If you have an air fryer, this is a great option for crispy and delicious tempeh! Add the tempeh to the basket and bake at 375ÂºF for about 15 minutes. Toss every 5 minutes for even cooking.
Marinated tempeh that's finished cooking in a large skillet.
How to Serve This Marinated Tempeh

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: This marinated tempeh is lovely served over rice or another grain like quinoa or millet. You can also serve it on cauliflower rice for a low-carb option. You can also pair it with a veggie side like my roasted broccoli or kale salad or try it in my tempeh bowls with pumpkin rice.
This easy marinated tempeh is my favorite way to cook tempeh. The maple balsamic sauce gives the tempeh so much flavor!

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: â–¢2 teaspoons avocado , or olive oil
â–¢3 Tablespoons low sodium tamari, soy sauce or coconut aminos
â–¢1 Tablespoon avocado or olive oil, for cooking
Remove tempeh from package and chop into small triangles by cutting the tempeh in half width-wise. Cut each half in a star pattern to get 16 mini triangles per package of tempeh, 32 triangles total.

In a small bowl combine maple syrup, balsamic vinegar, tamari, 2 teaspoons oil and minced garlic. Add tempeh triangles into a shallow dish with a large surface area, pour maple balsamic marinade over the tempeh, toss to coat and let tempeh marinate in the fridge for 1 â€“ 24 hours. Stir the mixture a couple times while marinating, if possible.

Pan-glaze the tempeh by heating 1 Tablespoon avocado oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Once oil is hot, add the tempeh (without pouring the marinade in) and cook until golden brown on each side, allowing 4-5 minutes per side. Pour the maple balsamic marinade into the pan with the tempeh and simmer another 5-7 minutes, or until the sauce has reduced creating a glaze on the tempeh. Toss the tempeh a couple times during this process.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: Once the sauce has thickened and all tempeh pieces are coated, the tempeh is ready to be served. I recommend serving it over rice, cauliflower rice or another grain and a veggie side.

ingredients: 1. Peel the cassava and cut it into small cubes. Place the cassava cubes in a pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil and let it cook for 15 minutes.
2. While the cassava is cooking, chop the tomatoes and onion into small pieces. Set aside.

3. Drain the cassava and mash it in a bowl until it becomes a smooth paste. Add in the chopped tomatoes and onion, along with the salt,  olive oil, parsley, cilantro, garlic powder, onion powder, cumin. Mix well.
4. In a separate bowl, beat the egg and milk together. Gradually add in the flour, stirring until a smooth batter forms.

5. Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat and add a small amount of oil. Once hot, scoop about 1/4 cup of the cassava mixture onto the pan and flatten it into a pancake shape. Repeat with the remaining mixture, leaving enough space between each pancake.
6. Cook the pancakes for about 3-4 minutes on each side, or until they turn golden brown and crispy.
7. Remove the pancakes from the pan and place them on a paper towel-lined plate to absorb any excess oil.
8. Serve the warm, topped with your favorite condiments such as sour cream or salsa.

Enjoy your delicious and unique twist on traditional pancakes with the added flavor and nutrition of cassava, tomato, and onion. These pancakes are perfect for breakfast, brunch, or even as a savory snack.ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹

ingredients: 1. Preheat your oven to 400 degrees Celsius.
2. Wash and dry 500g of okra and 500g of potatoes. Cut the okra into bite-sized pieces and the potatoes into small cubes.
3. Peel and mince 4 cloves of garlic.

4. In a large mixing bowl, add the okra and potatoes. Drizzle 2 tablespoons of olive oil over the vegetables and season with salt and pepper to taste. Mix well to evenly coat the vegetables with the oil and seasoning.
5. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and spread the okra and potato mixture in a single layer.
6. Crush the minced garlic over the vegetable mixture, making sure to distribute it evenly.
7. Bake in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and slightly crisp.
8. Once done, remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.
9. Garnish with extra garlic if desired and serve as a side dish or a light vegetarian meal.

ingredients: 1. Soak the dried chickpeas in water overnight or for at least 8 hours. Drain and rinse before using.
2. In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the diced onion and minced garlic, and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the soaked chickpeas to the pot along with the cumin, paprika, coriander, ginger, turmeric, cinnamon, and cayenne pepper. Stir to coat the chickpeas in the spices and cook for 2-3 minutes.
4. Pour in the diced tomatoes, vegetable broth, and water. Stir to combine and bring to a simmer. Cover the pot and let it cook for 1 hour, or until the chickpeas are tender.

ingredients: 2. In a large pot, add the soup and bring it to a boil. Reduce the heat and let it simmer while you prepare the other ingredients.
3. In a blender, blend together the onion, tomatoes, red bell peppers until smooth.
4. Heat up the palm oil on medium-high heat. Add the blended mixture and let it cook for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
5. Add the egusi to the pot and stir until well combined. Allow it to cook for 5 more minutes.
6. Now, add the prepared okra and stir gently. Let it cook for another 5 minutes.
7. Let the soup simmer on medium heat for about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally. If the soup becomes too thick, add more water or broth to achieve your desired consistency.
8. Finally, season with salt ğŸ§‚ to taste.
Your is now ready to be served. This hearty and flavorful soup is best enjoyed with a side of fufu or pounded yam.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. Rinse the okra and trim off the stems. Cut the okra into 1-inch pieces and set aside.
2. In a large pot, heat the coconut oil over medium-high heat. Add the onion and garlic and sautÃ© until translucent, about 2-3 minutes.
3. Add the diced red bell pepper to the pot and cook for another 2-3 minutes.
4. Stir in the red curry paste, ground coriander, ground cumin, turmeric, and salt. Cook for 1-2 minutes, until fragrant.
5. Pour in the vegetable soup and bring it to a simmer.
6. Add the okra to the pot and let it cook for about 8-10 minutes, until it is tender.
7. Pour in the coconut milk and stir in the soy sauce. Let the curry simmer for another 5 minutes.
8. Taste the curry and adjust the seasoning if needed. Add more salt, soy sauce according to your taste.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: - 1 cup dry lentils, rinsed and drained
- 1 cup fresh or frozen okra, chopped into bite-size pieces
- Fresh parsley or cilantro for garnish (optional)

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. In a large pot, combine the lentils and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and let simmer for 20 minutes. Drain and set aside.
2. In the same pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add cumin,coriander  and salt. Stir to combine and cook for 1-2 minutes.
4. Pour in diced tomatoes and vegetable broth, stir to combine, and bring to a simmer.
5. Add the cooked lentils and okra to the pot. Stir and let simmer for 20 minutes.
6. Serve hot, garnished with fresh parsley or cilantro, if desired.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: - If you prefer a thicker stew, you can mash some of the cooked lentils with a fork before adding the okra.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. Begin by cooking the pasta according to package instructions in a large pot of salted boiling water. Once cooked, drain and set aside.
2. While the pasta is cooking, prepare the okra by washing and trimming off the stems. Cut them into bite-sized pieces.
3. In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat. Add the okra and cook for 5-7 minutes until slightly tender. Set aside.
4. In the same skillet, add another tablespoon of olive oil and the sliced onions. Cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the onions are caramelized and golden brown.
5. Add the minced garlic to the skillet with the onions and cook for an additional 2 minutes.
6. Next, add the cherry tomatoes to the skillet and cook for 5 minutes until they start to burst and release their juices.
7. Season the onion and tomato mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
8. Add the cooked pasta and okra to the skillet and toss everything together until well combined.
9. Let the pasta cook for an additional 2-3 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
10. Serve the hot, garnished with some fresh herbs or grated parmesan cheese if desired.

ingredients: 1. Begin by heating olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add diced onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
2. Cut the okra into 1-inch pieces and add them to the pot. Cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
3. Add in the seasoning and stir until the okra is evenly coated.
4. Cut the tomatoes into small chunks and add them to the pot. Cook for an additional 5 minutes.
5. Cut the onion  into bite-sized pieces and add them to the pot. Cook.
6. Pour in the vegetable broth and stir well. Season with salt to taste.
7. Increase the heat to high and bring the mixture to a boil. Once boiling, reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
8. Serve hot, garnished with fresh parsley if desired.

This is a delicious and hearty meal. The combination of tender okra, juicy tomatoes, and flavorful seasoning, along with the savory onion, creates a dish that is bursting with flavor. Serve it as a main course or as a side dish to your favorite protein.
Enjoy the taste of this easy recipe!ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹

5. Pour the vegetable broth over the vegetables and bring the mixture to a boil. Once boiling, reduce the heat to medium and let it simmer for 20 minutes.

6. While the gumbo is simmering, prepare the sautÃ©ed onions. Heat the remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the remaining sliced onions and cook for 5-6 minutes until they are caramelized and golden brown.

*_Spicy Okra and Tomato Curry with Caramelized Onions_*

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: - tip of a teaspoon of cayenne pepper

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. Begin by washing and drying 500 grams of okra. Remove the tops and tips of the okra and cut them into 1-inch pieces.

2. Heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the okra and cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until they start to brown. Remove the okra from the pan and set aside.
3. In the same pan, add 2 large sliced onions and cook on low heat for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until they are caramelized.
4. While the onions are caramelizing, chop 400 grams of tomatoes into small pieces. Crush 2 cloves of garlic and grate 1 tablespoon of ginger.
5. Once the onions are caramelized, add the garlic and ginger to the pan and cook for 1-2 minutes.
6. Add the chopped tomatoes to the pan and cook for 5-7 minutes until they start to break down.
7. Add 1 teaspoon each of cumin, coriander, turmeric, and cayenne pepper to the pan and mix well.
8. Return the okra to the pan and stir everything together. Add salt to taste.
9. Cover the pan and let the curry simmer for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the okra is tender.
10. Once the okra is cooked, remove the lid and let the curry cook for an additional 5 minutes to thicken.
11. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve.
Enjoy the delicious and flavorful combination of spicy okra and sweet caramelized onions!ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹

4. Add the okra to the pot and stir to combine with the onions and garlic. Cook for 5-7 minutes, until the okra begins to soften.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: This is a delicious and hearty dish that is perfect for any season. The combination of the okra and tomatoes creates a flavorful base, while the caramelized onions add a touch of sweetness. Serve this stew for a satisfying meal.

ingredients: 1. Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan over a medium heat.
2. Add the potatoes and carrots and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
3. Add the cumin, coriander and ginger and mix to combine.
4. Pour in the vegetable stock and bring to the boil.
5. Reduce the heat and simmer for 15 minutes, until the potatoes and carrots are tender.
6. Remove from the heat and blend the soup using a hand blender until smooth.
7. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

*Vegetable stock is the liquid produced by simmering aromatic vegetables in water. Often made with a base of onions, celery, and carrots, vegetable stock can also incorporate leftover vegetable bits and pieces.*

Brown them for about 5 minutes in the skillet with some olive oil, shaking the pan to roll them around to brown all sides.
Put meatballs on a bare baking sheet and transfer to the preheated oven (375F/190C) and bake for 15 minutes.
In the meantime prepare some vegan spaghetti and tomato sauce.
Once meatballs are golden brown, remove from oven. Let cool briefly before serving.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. Heat a large pot over medium-high heat. Add in olive oil and garlic and stir for 1 minute.
2. Add the potatoes and carrots and cook, stirring occasionally, for 8 minutes.
3. Pour in the vegetable stock and add in the thyme, salt, and pepper. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes.
4. Use an immersion blender to blend the soup until smooth. Serve warm.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan over a medium heat.
2. Add the potatoes and carrots and cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
3. Add the cumin, coriander and ginger and mix to combine.
4. Pour in the vegetable stock and bring to the boil.
5. Reduce the heat and simmer for 15 minutes, until the potatoes and carrots are tender.
6. Remove from the heat and blend the soup using a hand blender until smooth.
7. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 2. Place the chickpeas in a bowl and drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with salt and mix well to coat. Spread in an even layer on a baking tray and bake for 15 minutes or until crispy.
3. Heat the remaining olive oil in a large soup pot over a medium-high heat. Add the potatoes and carrots and cook, stirring, for 5 minutes or until lightly browned.
4. Add the vegetable stock, cumin and coriander and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes or until the vegetables are tender.
5. Use an immersion blender to blend the soup until smooth.
6. Serve the soup hot topped with the crispy chickpeas.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic, onion, thyme, parsley and bay leaves and cook for 5 minutes until softened.
2. Add potatoes and carrots to the pan and cook for a further 5 minutes. Pour in the vegetable stock and bring to the boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 20 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
3. Remove from the heat and discard the bay leaves. Blend the soup using a stick blender until smooth. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

4. For the herbed croutons, preheat the oven to 200ÂºC/400ÂºF. Place the cubed bread onto a baking tray. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with rosemary and thyme. Bake in the oven for 10 minutes or until golden and crispy.
5. Serve the soup with the herbed croutons.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1 cup white or yellow onion, diced
Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add celery, onions, bell peppers, and carrots.
Stir in garlic and cook until fragrant.
Bring to a boil and then reduce heat to a simmer.
Cook until the cabbage is tender.
Stir in oregano, basil, red pepper flakes, and salt
Taste broth and adjust seasoning if needed.
What is vegetable broth made of?
*Vegetable Broth -Water,Salt, Carrot Juice, Tomato Paste, Mirepoix (Carrots, Onions, Celery), Flour.*
What vegetables can be used in vegetable broth?

_Other vegetables and herbs to consider adding: mushrooms, eggplant, asparagus trimmings, corn cobs, fennel stalks and trimmings, bell peppers, pea pods, chard stems and leaves, celery root trimmings, and basil stems and leaves._

ingredients: 1. Begin by preparing the lettuce. Rinse the lettuce leaves thoroughly under running water and pat them dry with a clean kitchen towel or paper towels. Then, tear the leaves into bite-sized pieces and place them in a large mixing bowl.
2. Next, wash the tomatoes and chop them into small cubes. Add the chopped tomatoes to the bowl with the lettuce.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 3. In a small mixing bowl, whisk together the olive oil, apple cider vinegar, minced garlic, and a pinch of salt and black pepper. This will be the dressing for the salad.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 4. Pour the dressing over the lettuce and tomatoes in the large mixing bowl. Use tongs or clean hands to gently toss the salad, ensuring that the dressing is evenly distributed.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: This salad is perfect as a side dish for any meal, or you can add some protein such as tofu to make it a complete meal. The tangy dressing adds a burst of flavor to the crisp lettuce and juicy tomatoes, making it a refreshing and healthy option for any occasion.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. Preheat your oven to 375 degrees Celsius. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

2. Place the soya mince on the baking sheet and bake for 12-15 minutes until crispy. Once done, remove from the oven and let it cool down. Once cooled, crumble the  soya mince into small pieces and set aside.
3. In a small bowl, mix together the mayonnaise,  mustard, garlic powder, and onion powder. This will be your dressing for the cups.
4. Wash the lettuce leaves and pat them dry. Lay the leaves on a flat surface.
5. In a separate bowl, mix together the diced tomato and the soya mince.
6. Take a lettuce leaf and spoon the soya mince and tomato mixture onto it. Drizzle some of the dressing on top.
7. In the same bowl, mix together the bread crumbs and salt. Sprinkle this mixture on top of the soya mince and tomato mixture.
8. Carefully fold the lettuce leaf into a cup shape, securing the filling inside.
9. Repeat this process for the remaining lettuce leaves.
10. Place the lettuce cups on a baking sheet and bake for 8-10 minutes until the bread crumbs are golden brown and the lettuce is slightly wilted.
11. Serve warm and enjoy your ! You can also add some extra dressing on top for added flavor. These cups make for a delicious and healthy snack or appetizer.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. Cook the pasta according to package instructions in a pot of salted boiling water. Once cooked, drain and rinse with cold water to stop the cooking process. Set aside.
2. While the pasta is cooking, prepare the lettuce and tomatoes. Wash and dry the lettuce, then tear it into bite-sized pieces. Cut the cherry tomatoes in half and set them aside.
3. In a small mixing bowl, combine the mayonnaise, sour cream, mustard, olive oil, minced garlic, and salt. Whisk until well combined and set aside.
4. In a large mixing bowl, add the cooked and cooled pasta, lettuce, and cherry tomatoes. Pour the dressing over the top and gently toss to combine, making sure everything is evenly coated.
5. Serve immediately or refrigerate for at least 1 hour to allow the flavors to meld together.
6. Optional: for added protein, you can add tofu.

ingredients: 1. Begin by preparing the vegetables. Peel and dice the onion ğŸ§… and garlic ğŸ§„ cloves. Wash and roughly chop the spinach â˜˜ï¸ leaves. Peel the potatoes ğŸ¥” and cut them into bite-sized cubes.

3. Add the chopped potatoes ğŸ¥” to the pot and stir to combine with the onion ğŸ§… and garlic ğŸ§„. Let the potatoes ğŸ¥” cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
4. Pour in the vegetable broth and bring it to a boil. Lower the heat to a simmer and let the vegetables cook for 20 minutes, or until the potatoes ğŸ¥” are fork-tender.

5. Once the potatoes ğŸ¥” are cooked, turn off the heat and let the soup cool for a few minutes. Then, using an immersion blender, blend the soup ğŸ² ğŸ² ğŸ² until it becomes smooth and creamy. If you do not have an immersion blender, carefully transfer the soup to a traditional blender and blend until smooth.

6. After blending, return the soup ğŸ² ğŸ² ğŸ² to the pot and place it back on the stove over low heat. Stir in the chopped spinach â˜˜ï¸ and let it cook for 2-3 minutes until the spinach â˜˜ï¸ has wilted.

8. Serve the hot ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥ğŸ¥µğŸ¥µğŸ¥µ, with optional toppings such as croutons, grated parmesan cheese, and chopped fresh herbs for added texture and flavor.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. Start by preparing the samp according to package instructions. This usually involves soaking the samp overnight and then cooking it in boiling water for about an hour or until tender. Drain and set aside.

2. In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the diced onion, garlic, and red bell pepper. Cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are soft and slightly caramelized.
3. Cut the vegetarian sausage into bite-sized pieces and add them to the skillet. Cook for about 5 minutes, until the vegetarian sausage is browned and cooked through.
4. Add the cooked samp to the skillet and stir to combine with the vegetables and vegetarian sausage.
5. Sprinkle the cumin over the mixture and stir to evenly coat everything.
6. Season with salt to taste. Remember, the vegetarian sausage will already have some saltiness so be mindful when adding salt.
7. Cook for an additional 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, to allow the flavors to combine and the spices to fully coat the samp and vegetarian sausage.
8. Once everything is heated through and well combined, remove the skillet from the heat.
9. Serve the hot and garnish with fresh parsley, if desired.
*This dish can be enjoyed as is. The spicy flavors of cumin combine with the hearty texture of the samp and the savory taste of the vegetarian sausage to create a satisfying and flavorful meal.*

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. In a medium saucepan, combine the groundnut butter, coconut milk, water, rolled oats, banana slices, honey, chia seeds, ground cinnamon, and vanilla extract. Stir well to combine.
2. Place the saucepan over medium heat and bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce heat to low and let the porridge simmer for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally.
3. While the porridge is simmering, preheat a small non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add the shredded coconut and toast for 2-3 minutes until golden brown. Set aside.
4. Once the porridge is cooked and thickened to your desired consistency, remove from heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
5. Transfer the porridge to a serving bowl and top with the toasted coconut.

_Enjoy your hot, or let it cool down and refrigerate for a yummy breakfast the next day. You can also add additional toppings such as fresh fruit, nuts, or a drizzle of extra honey for added sweetness._

*This creamy and delicious porridge bowl is a perfect blend of African and tropical flavors, making it a unique and flavorful breakfast option. The groundnut butter adds protein and healthy fats, while the coconut milk adds a rich and creamy texture. This recipe can be easily adjusted to your liking by adding more or less water depending on how thick you prefer your porridge. So next time you're craving a warm and comforting breakfast, give this a try!ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹*
*_Mango Coconut Overnight Oats with Vegan Yogurt_*

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: - 1 cup coconut milk (or any plant-based milk)
- Optional toppings: sliced almonds, extra diced mango, and honey (or maple syrup) for sweetness.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. In a medium-sized bowl, mix together the rolled oats, coconut milk, and vegan yogurt until well combined.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 2. Add in the diced mango, chia seeds, and shredded coconut. Stir well to evenly distribute all the ingredients.
3. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap or transfer the mixture into an airtight container.
4. Place the bowl or container in the refrigerator and let the oats soak overnight, or for at least 6-8 hours.
5. In the morning, give the oats a quick stir. If the mixture is too thick, you can add more coconut milk or water to achieve your desired consistency.
6. Transfer the oat mixture into serving bowls or jars. Top with sliced almonds, extra diced mango, and a drizzle of honey (or maple syrup) for sweetness.
Enjoy your delicious and nutritious for a quick and easy breakfast or snack option.
- You can use any type of vegan yogurt for this recipe, such as almond or coconut yogurt.
- If you prefer a sweeter taste, you can add a bit more honey or maple syrup to the oats before soaking overnight.
- The chia seeds and shredded coconut add extra fiber and healthy fats, but you can omit them if desired.
- For a tropical twist, you can also add some diced pineapple or banana to the oats.
- This recipe can be easily doubled or tripled to make multiple servings for meal prep.
- You can also use frozen mango if fresh is not available, just make sure to let it thaw before adding it to the oat mixture.ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹

ingredients: 1. In a small pan, toast the cumin and coriander seeds over medium heat until fragrant, about 2-3 minutes. Remove from heat and crush the seeds using a mortar and pestle or a spice grinder.

ingredients: 1. Begin by heating olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add diced onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
2. Cut the okra into 1-inch pieces and add them to the pot. Cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
3. Add in the seasoning and stir until the okra is evenly coated.
4. Cut the tomatoes into small chunks and add them to the pot. Cook for an additional 5 minutes.
5. Cut the onion  into bite-sized pieces and add them to the pot. Cook.
6. Pour in the vegetable broth and stir well. Season with salt to taste.
7. Increase the heat to high and bring the mixture to a boil. Once boiling, reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
8. Serve hot, garnished with fresh parsley if desired.

This is a delicious and hearty meal. The combination of tender okra, juicy tomatoes, and flavorful seasoning, along with the savory onion, creates a dish that is bursting with flavor. Serve it as a main course or as a side dish to your favorite protein.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: To create a superb side of soft, caramelized roasted mushrooms, use simple, simple ingredients.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: And we're here to demonstrate it! When mushrooms are oven-roasted at high temperatures for a brief period of time, the water is able to escape, leaving behind soft, melt-in-your-mouth interiors and golden-brown caramelized exteriors. You'll find earthy, meaty, herbaceous, and crave-worthy bits of flavor in this recipe for roasted mushrooms. They just require eight ingredients and are quick, simple, and extremely tasty. These are vegan and paleo-friendly, making them the ideal savory side for all dietary requirements! We also enjoy dry-sautÃ© mushrooms, even though roasting them is the simplest way to prepare them and intensify their flavor.
Are Roasted Mushrooms Good For You?

Oven roasted mushrooms are super underrated! Not only are they earthy, savory, and meaty but also are packed with nutrients! Roasted mushrooms in the oven are generally low in calories and fat and are great to bulk up a meal. They contain Vitamin D, riboflavin, potassium and are a good source of fiber! Some experts even say that roast mushrooms can help boost your immune system, have anti-cancer properties, and lower your blood pressure due to their antioxidants!
How Do You Keep Mushrooms From Getting Soggy In The Oven?

â€¦is one of the most common questions we get asked! No one likes soggy, slimy mushrooms and so weâ€™re here to give you all the tips and tricks, for tender, flavorful mushrooms oven roasted with toasty, crispy exteriors:
Gently clean your mushrooms with a paper towel rather than running them under cold water.

Since mushrooms are a high water content food, meaning that their sponge-like structure allows for water to be released during cooking, we recommend that if juices pool halfway through baking, drain them off the tray so they continue to roast instead of steam.
When in doubt, salt after, prevents the water from being released more rapidly during cooking.
Oven-roasted mushrooms can go with just about any dish: theyâ€™re extremely versatile, light yet still hearty!

Sprinkle them over our Creamy Mashed Potatoes and Green Bean Almondine. Add them to Alfredo Sauce or Homemade Marinara to bulk up the sauce. They also go great with pasta such as Vegan Cauliflower Gnocchi, Sausage Kale Pasta with Lemon Cream Sauce, or Creamy Roasted Red Pepper Pasta. There are so many ways to devour roasted mushrooms but our favorite way is straight from the baking sheet.
Follow our step-by-step instructions below for perfectly crispy outsides and tender insides each and every time:

Prep! For our roasted mushrooms recipe, we use cremini mushrooms but you can make it your own and roast portobello, shiitake, or button mushrooms â€“ whatever you have available! Cut into quarters and drizzle with olive oil and salt! Pro tip: place them cut-side down in a single layer to get that crispy bottom!

Cook! Youâ€™ll do this in two iterations at 450Â°F. First, cook them for 10 minutes. They might start to release some water so now is a great time to remove the liquid from the rimmed baking sheet. Add in the garlic and thyme halfway through so it doesnâ€™t burn! Toss them and then return them to a single layer, preferably on the other cut side for optimal golden-brown color!
Garnish with fresh parsley and enjoy! Roast mushrooms will become caramelized on the outside and soft on the inside!
Tools Youâ€™ll Need For Roasted Mushrooms
