ingredients: Place the mushrooms on a rimmed sheet pan. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Toss to coat.

Spread the mushrooms out in a single layer and bake for 10 minutes. Remove from the oven, add the garlic and thyme and toss to combine. Place back in the oven and continue to cook until the mushrooms are caramelized and soft, about 10 more minutes.
Remove from the oven and toss with parsley before serving.

ingredients: 1. In a large skillet, heat 1 tbsp of olive oil over medium heat. Add 1 diced onion and 2 minced garlic cloves and cook until softened, about 2-3 minutes.
2. Add 200g of soya mince to the skillet and cook for about 5 minutes, until browned.
3. Add 1 tsp of cumin, and 1 tsp of dried oregano to the skillet and stir to combine.
4. Drain and rinse 200g of lentils and add them to the skillet. Stir to combine with the soya mince mixture.
5. Pour 1 can of diced tomatoes into the skillet and stir. Let the mixture simmer for 10 minutes, until the liquid has reduced and the lentils are tender.
6. While the mixture is simmering, heat up the tortillas according to package instructions.
7. To assemble the tacos, place a scoop of the soya mince and lentil mixture onto a tortilla. Add desired toppings such as shredded cheese, avocado, salsa, and sour cream.
8. Serve immediately and enjoy your delicious meal !ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹

*Tortilla, round, thin, flat bread of Mexico made from unleavened cornmeal or, less commonly, wheat flour. Traditionally, the corn (maize) for tortillas was boiled with unslaked lime to soften the kernels and loosen the hulls. (This lime was the principal source of calcium in the Mexican diet.)*

ingredients: 1. Begin by preparing the vegetables. Cut the zucchinis into thick slices, deseed and slice the bell peppers, and slice the red onion. Peel and mince the garlic cloves.
2. Preheat your grill to medium-high heat. Meanwhile, drain the block of tofu and pat it dry with paper towels. Cut the tofu into bite-sized cubes.
3. In a small bowl, mix together the soy sauce, honey, ginger powder, and a pinch of salt.
4. In a large bowl, add the sliced vegetables and tofu. Pour the marinade over the vegetables and tofu, and gently toss to ensure everything is coated evenly.

5. Thread the vegetables and tofu onto skewers, alternating between them. If using wooden skewers, make sure to soak them in water for at least 30 minutes beforehand to prevent them from burning on the grill.
6. Grill the skewers for 10-12 minutes, turning occasionally, until the vegetables are slightly charred and the tofu is heated through.
7. While the skewers are grilling, heat a large wok or pan over medium-high heat. Add 2 tablespoons of olive oil and swirl to coat the pan.
8. Cut the sanguage sausages into bite-sized pieces and add them to the pan. Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until slightly browned.
9. Add the minced garlic to the pan and stir-fry for an additional minute.

*Tofu is made from dried soybeans that are soaked in water, crushed, and boiled. The mixture is separated into solid pulp (okara) and soy â€œmilk.â€ Salt coagulants, such as calcium and magnesium chlorides and sulfates, are added to the soy milk to separate the curds from the whey.*
What is tofu called in English?

_Tofu (è±†è…), sometimes called doufu (usually used in Chinese recipes) or bean curd (literal translation), is a food made from soybeans. In fact, it is a very complex process. Tofu is made by coagulating soy milk into curds._
*Tofu is a vegetable protein. Even though it is derived from a plant (soybeans) it is processed into a protein food.*

*_What Does Tofu Taste Like? Plain tofu has no specific flavor and is honestly, quite bland. This might be why people tend to hate it but the fact that it's bland is exactly why we should LOVE it. The texture of tofu is more important than the taste- all the different types of tofu have different textures._*

_Tofu has fiber, and high-fiber diets keep your colon healthy and cancer risk low. Memory and brain health. Some studies suggest soy foods like tofu might prevent memory loss and trouble thinking as you get older._

*Yes, it's safe to eat raw firm tofu. It has a mild taste and a somewhat spongy texture. To enhance its flavor, you can marinate or season it. Try slicing it into cubes or strips, then marinate in a mixture of soy sauce, sesame oil, and your choice of herbs or spices.*

_Tofu is made from soybeans that are ground in water, heated, and coagulated with minerals like calcium or magnesium salt. The curds are then pressed into a block, which is then sold as tofu. You can buy several different types of tofu, from extra-soft silken tofu to extra-firm tofu._

*This stir fry vegetable pasta is just fantastic for these picnics, late lunches, and lazy dinners. One great thing about this stir fry pasta dish is that kids love them. If you are always searching for new ideas to feed your kids vegetables, then you should be happy that this recipe is just amazing.*

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: *_What Ingredients are needed for This Stir Fry Pasta?_*
*Pasta- organic corkscrew pasta for this recipe. You can use any pasta, such as chickpea pasta, whole wheat pasta, or typical pasta. It depends on your preference, taste, and choice.*
_Vegetables-Onion, garlic, ginger, green chilies, broccoli, carrot, green onion, zucchini, green beans, and mushrooms are used in this recipe. You can use your favorites._
*Sauce- dark soy sauce, chili oil/chili sauce, apple cider vinegar, red pepper flakes, and salt for making the sauce. It has a hint of sweetness, tanginess, and spiciness.*

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: *_Stir fry vegetable pasta. A simple stir fry pasta with an Asian flavored sauce and crunchy vegetables. Perfect for summer months, this pasta is light, flavorful, and totally delicious. Perfect for packed lunches and picnic meals this salad is vegan and kid-approved._*

*_Grilled Veggie and Sanguage Stir-Fry Bowl with Tofu_*

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. Begin by preparing the vegetables. Cut the zucchinis into thick slices, deseed and slice the bell peppers, and slice the red onion. Peel and mince the garlic cloves.
2. Preheat your grill to medium-high heat. Meanwhile, drain the block of tofu and pat it dry with paper towels. Cut the tofu into bite-sized cubes.
3. In a small bowl, mix together the soy sauce, honey, ginger powder, and a pinch of salt.
4. In a large bowl, add the sliced vegetables and tofu. Pour the marinade over the vegetables and tofu, and gently toss to ensure everything is coated evenly.

5. Thread the vegetables and tofu onto skewers, alternating between them. If using wooden skewers, make sure to soak them in water for at least 30 minutes beforehand to prevent them from burning on the grill.
6. Grill the skewers for 10-12 minutes, turning occasionally, until the vegetables are slightly charred and the tofu is heated through.
7. While the skewers are grilling, heat a large wok or pan over medium-high heat. Add 2 tablespoons of olive oil and swirl to coat the pan.
8. Cut the sanguage sausages into bite-sized pieces and add them to the pan. Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until slightly browned.
9. Add the minced garlic to the pan and stir-fry for an additional minute.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 10. Add the cooked rice to the pan and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until heated through.
11. Once the skewers are done, remove them from the grill and slide the vegetables and tofu off the skewers into the stir-fry pan. Stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes until everything is well.

Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. Cook the jollof rice according to package instructions. Once cooked, set aside and keep warm.
2. In a large wok or pan, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
3. Add the diced onion and minced garlic to the hot oil and sautÃ© until fragrant.
4. Next, add the sliced red and green bell peppers, along with the sliced carrot. Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until the vegetables start to soften.
5. Add the trimmed green beans and broccoli florets to the pan and continue to stir-fry for an additional 2-3 minutes.
6. In a small bowl, mix together the soy sauce, curry powder, and thyme. Pour the mixture over the vegetables in the pan and stir to coat.
7. Season the stir-fry with salt and pepper to taste.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 8. Finally, add the cooked jollof rice to the pan and mix well with the vegetables and sauce. Stir-fry for an additional 2-3 minutes until everything is heated through.
9. Serve the hot, garnished with additional thyme if desired.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: This dish is a perfect balance of flavorful jollof rice and healthy stir-fried vegetables. It can be enjoyed as a main course or served as a side dish with your favorite protein.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. Begin by pressing the tofu. Place the block of tofu on a plate lined with paper towels and cover the top with more paper towels. Place a heavy object, such as a cast iron skillet, on top of the tofu to help press out any excess moisture. Let it sit for 15 minutes while you prepare the vegetables.
2. Wash and chop the bell peppers, zucchini, carrot, and onion into bite-sized pieces. Mince the garlic and grate the ginger.
3. In a small bowl, mix together the soy sauce, sesame oil, cornstarch, chili flakes, and a pinch of salt and pepper. Set aside.
4. Heat a large wok or non-stick pan over medium-high heat and add enough vegetable oil to cover the bottom of the pan.

5. Carefully place the tofu in the hot oil and cook for 2-3 minutes on each side, until crispy and golden brown. Remove the tofu from the pan and place it on a plate lined with paper towels to absorb any excess oil.
6. In the same pan, add the minced garlic and grated ginger. Cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
7. Add the chopped vegetables to the pan and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes, until they begin to soften.
8. Pour the sauce mixture over the vegetables and stir to coat evenly. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes until the sauce thickens and coats the vegetables.
9. Add the crispy tofu back into the pan and toss to combine with the vegetables and sauce. Cook for another 1-2 minutes until everything is heated through.

*_Savory Spinach and Feta Crepes using Whole Wheat Flour_*

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the whole wheat flour, eggs, milk, melted butter and a pinch of salt. Whisk until well combined and smooth. Let the batter rest for 10 minutes.
2. In a non-stick pan, heat a small amount of olive oil over medium heat.
3. Wash the spinach thoroughly and remove any tough stems. Chop the spinach into small pieces.
4. Once the pan is hot, pour a ladle full of the crepe batter and swirl it around to cover the bottom of the pan. Cook for about 1-2 minutes until the edges start to brown.
5. Sprinkle a handful of chopped spinach on one half of the crepe and crumble some feta cheese on top.
6. Using a spatula, fold the other half of the crepe over the spinach and feta filling, creating a half-moon shape. Press down lightly with the spatula to seal the edges.
7. Cook for another 1-2 minutes until the bottom is golden brown.
8. Carefully flip the crepe over and cook for another minute until the other side is also golden brown.
9. Repeat the process with the remaining batter and filling, adding more oil to the pan as needed.
10. Serve the savory spinach and feta crepes hot.
*_Chocolate Chip Banana Bread made with Wheat Flour_*

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. Preheat your oven to 350ÂºF (175ÂºC) and grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine the wheat flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt. Set aside.
3. In a separate bowl, mash the ripe bananas until smooth.
4. Add in the melted butter, brown sugar, vanilla extract, and eggs to the mashed bananas and mix until well combined.
5. Slowly pour the wet banana mixture into the dry flour mixture and stir until just combined.
6. Gently fold in the chocolate chips.
7. Pour the batter into the greased loaf pan and smooth the top with a spatula.
8. Bake for 50-60 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
9. Let the bread cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then remove and transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
- Make sure to use ripe bananas for maximum sweetness and flavor in the bread.
- You can substitute whole wheat flour for regular wheat flour for a healthier option.
- For an extra burst of flavor, you can add 1 tsp of cinnamon to the dry flour mixture.
- Store any leftovers in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days, or in the refrigerator for up to a week. You can also freeze slices for longer storage.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: *_Spicy Beetroot and Carrot Salad with Cumin and Coriander_*

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: - 300g beetroot, peeled and cut into thin strips
- 300g carrot, peeled and cut into thin strips

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. In a small pan, toast the cumin and coriander seeds over medium heat until fragrant, about 2-3 minutes. Remove from heat and crush the seeds using a mortar and pestle or a spice grinder.
2. In a mixing bowl, combine the crushed seeds with minced garlic, olive oil, honey, and apple cider vinegar. Whisk until well combined.
3. Add the beetroot and carrot strips to the dressing and toss to coat evenly. Let it marinate for at least 30 minutes, or up to 2 hours, in the refrigerator.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 4. In a separate bowl, toss the mixed salad greens with a pinch of salt and pepper.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen

ingredients: 1. Cook the samp according to package instructions until it is soft and tender. Drain and set it aside to cool.

ingredients: 1. In a large pot, heat a tablespoon of olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the diced sweet potatoes and cook for about 5 minutes, until they start to soften.
2. Add the diced onion, minced garlic, and diced red bell pepper to the pot. Cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender.
3. Add black beans, diced tomatoes, and vegetable broth to the pot. Stir to combine.
4. Season with cumin, and salt to taste. Stir well to distribute the spices.
5. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 20 minutes, until the sweet potatoes are fully cooked and the flavors have developed.
6. Serve the in bowls, and top with your choice of optional toppings, such as diced avocado, chopped cilantro, shredded cheese, sour cream, and a squeeze of lime juice.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. Peel and chop the sweet potatoes into small cubes.
2. In a pot, bring 1 cup of water to a boil. Add the sweet potatoes and cook for 10 minutes or until tender.
3. In a separate pot, combine the groundnut butter, groundnut milk, ground cinnamon, ground nutmeg, and ground ginger. Cook on medium heat, stirring constantly, for 5 minutes.
4. Add the cooked sweet potatoes to the groundnut mixture and mash them with a potato masher until well incorporated.
5. Gradually stir in the honey, shredded coconut, and chopped almonds. Cook for an additional 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the porridge thickens.
6. Remove from heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. Serve the warm in bowls. Top with additional shredded coconut and chopped almonds, if desired.

*African-inspired porridge for breakfast or as a warm and comforting snack. The combination of sweet potatoes and groundnut butter provides a good balance of carbohydrates, protein, and healthy fats, making this porridge a satisfying and filling meal.*
_Experiment with different spices and toppings to make it your own._

Coriander and parsley are both popular herbs, but they belong to different plant families.

Coriander (Coriandrum sativum) is a member of the *Apiaceae family*, which includes other plants like carrots, celery, and dill. This family is characterized by umbrella-like flower clusters and often hollow stems.
Parsley (Petroselinum crispum), on the other hand, is also part of the *Apiaceae family*. Despite their different flavors and appearances, both coriander and parsley share this family connection.
Some key similarities between coriander and parsley include:
- *Umbel-shaped flowers*: Both plants produce flower clusters in the shape of umbrellas.
- *Similar leaf structure*: Both have compound or divided leaves.
However, they differ in taste, aroma, and appearance:
- *Coriander* has a warm, citrusy flavor and is often used in Middle Eastern, Indian, and Asian dishes.
- *Parsley* has a fresh, green taste and is commonly used as a garnish or added to Mediterranean and Western dishes.
So, while coriander and parsley arenâ€™t the same plant, they do belong to the same plant familyâ€”*Apiaceae*!

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: *_Basic (but very good) granola requires just a handful of ingredients:_* rolled oats, a sweetener, some cooking oil, and maybe nuts or dried fruit. Once you master that basic formula, itâ€™s easy to customize a mix for your own preferences.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: What every granola-loving home cook needs is a simple, straightforward recipe that can be memorized and made from heart. This recipe is just that â€” a very basic granola that will teach you the basics of cooking oats with a little sweetener, seasoning, and a few additions. Our formula uses seven ingredients.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: Youâ€™ll end up with a simple granola to eat by the handful or in a bowl with yogurt or milk. Start by learning this basic method so you can customize all your future batches with whatever youâ€™re in the mood for.

Once youâ€™re comfortable with this basic recipe, youâ€™re ready to experiment. Swap in cashews, hazelnuts, or pistachios. Dice some dried apricots, dates, or figs. Try cardamom or allspice instead of cinnamon. The variations are almost endless.

Keep it 50-50. The coating for your granola should be about half sweetener and half oil. Honey and maple syrup are two of the best sweeteners you can use for granola because their liquid state coats each oat well. This recipe will give you granola with a familiar level of sweetness, but you can reduce the honey and oil by as much as half and still have excellent granola.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: Get as clumpy as you like. The internet is littered with tricks for clumpy granola, but you donâ€™t need special ingredients for nice, simple chunks â€” just a few steps. First, press the granola into an even layer before you put it in the oven. Then, stir it only once halfway through cooking. For really good clumps, press down on the finished granola before it cools and avoid jostling it on the pan until cooled completely.

Know when the granola is done. Arguably the hardest part of baking granola is knowing when itâ€™s done. Using a low oven temperature helps dry out the granola without over-baking it. Keep in mind that the granola wonâ€™t be dry right out of the oven â€” it will dry as it cools. So take it out of the oven when it looks lightly toasted and smells like cooked honey.
Weâ€™re going for a toasty smell here.
Add dried fruit after baking. You can toast most nuts with the oats in the oven, but dried fruit will burn on the pan, so be sure to add it after baking.
For the longest shelf life, completely cool the granola on the pan before transferring to a storage container. When stored in an airtight container, this granola will keep for up to a month.

Eat it like cereal with milk or sprinkle over yogurt for a simple breakfast you can take anywhere. Try this recipe straight up or tweak it slightly using different sweeteners, seasonings, or swapping the nuts or fruit for your favorite. With this simple easy granola, the possibilities are almost endless.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1/2 cup neutral oil, such as sunflower or grapeseed
1 cup raisins or other dried, chopped fruit
Heat the oven to 300Â°F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Arrange a rack in the middle of the oven and heat the oven to 300Â°F.
Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper.
Whisk together the oil, honey, cinnamon, and salt.
Place the oil, honey, cinnamon, and salt in a large bowl and whisk to combine.
Add the oats and almonds and stir to coat.
Go ahead and measure the oats and almonds right into the oil mixture â€” donâ€™t worry if you add a little more oats or almonds â€” granola is very forgiving.
Spread the oats out onto the prepared baking sheet.
Transfer the mixture to the prepared baking sheet and spread into an even layer.
If the granola is clumpy, use a spatula to press it into the pan.
Bake for 20 minutes, stirring halfway through.

Bake, stirring halfway through, for about 20 minutes total. The granola is ready when golden-brown and the almonds have toasted â€” it will still feel wet coming out of the oven but will dry as it cools.
Remove from the oven, add the fruit, tamp down, and cool.
Place the baking sheet on a wire rack and sprinkle on the raisins or fruit. If you want clumps of granola, press and tamp down the granola before it cools, which will help it stick together.
Transfer the cooled granola to an airtight container for long-term storage at room temperature.
*_Gluten-free: For gluten-free granola, make sure the oats were processed in a gluten-free facility._*
*Storage: Granola can be stored in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 1 month.*
*_This granola makes a wonderful meal (add your milk of choice and maybe some fresh fruit). It also stores beautifully, so it makes a great homemade gift._*
Once you try homemade granola, you wonâ€™t go back to store-bought granola. Itâ€™s so much better!

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: This granola recipe is also a far more healthy granola option, since itâ€™s made with whole grains, unrefined oil and naturally sweetened. You just canâ€™t beat freshly baked granola packed with delicious and good-for-you ingredients.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: Plus, homemade granola is super easy to make. Youâ€™ll only need one bowl and some basic pantry ingredients.
Now that you have my base recipe, you can play around with the mix-ins and spices to make it your favorite granola.
By the way, you can preserve that freshly baked flavor by storing this granola in the freezer. Just let it warm to room temperature for a few minutes, and enjoy.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: Heart-healthy, hearty, whole-grain old-fashioned oats keep their shape during baking. Be sure to use certified gluten-free oats if you need gluten-free granola.

I used pecans and pepitas (green pumpkin seeds) to make this batch. Other options include walnuts, which are rich in Omega-3s, whole or slivered almonds, cashews, peanuts, pistachios, macadamia nuts and sunflower seeds.
Oil helps make this granola crisp and irresistible. I prefer unrefined coconut oil, which is delicious (you can barely taste the coconut, if at all) and produces the perfect texture.
You can use extra-virgin olive oil instead, if youâ€™d like your granola to be a little more on the savory side. If youâ€™re watching your saturated fat intake, olive oil is a better choice!
I love using real maple syrup in my granola. Honey works great, too. As a bonus, these natural sweeteners infuse your granola extra-delicious flavor that sugar would not.

For flavorful granola, donâ€™t skip the salt! Too little and your flavors wonâ€™t sing. I prefer using fine-grain sea salt in this one (I always cook with fine-grain sea salt), but regular salt will do, too (just use a little less).
I added cinnamon to this batch for some subtle warming spice. Ground ginger (use half as much) and pumpkin spice blends are other options.
Dried fruit lends some extra sweetness, chewy texture and irresistible fruity flavor. I used dried cranberries for this batch. I also love tart dried cherries, raisins and chopped dried apricots.
For fresh citrus flavor, stir fresh citrus zest (up to 2 teaspoons) into the mixture before baking. I love adding orange zest, in particular.

ingredients: For generations, small grains such as sorghum, finger millet,  pearl millet and Brown rice(MUPUNGA)have been staples in African households. Despite their long-standing presence in traditional diets, these grains have often been unfairly stigmatized as â€œfood for the poor.â€ Historically, consuming small grains was seen as a sign of povertyâ€”linked to those who could not afford to grow or purchase maize meal. Yet, this perception is rapidly changing as the value of these traditional grains is being rediscovered.

Today, small grains are being hailed as â€œthe new goldâ€ for their impressive health benefits and versatility. They can be consumed whole, cooked, or processed into flour and porridge, among other uses. The recent surge in their popularity is largely due to the global rise in chronic health conditions such as high blood pressure, high cholesterol, obesity, diabetes, and cancer. As people search for healthier alternatives, health professionalsâ€”particularly nutritionistsâ€”have championed the return to traditional diets, urging a shift away from overly processed modern foods.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: Nutritionally, small grains are powerhouses. Sorghum, finger millet, pearl millet  and brown rice (mupunga)are rich in proteins, essential vitamins, minerals, and complex carbohydrates. While maize meal may contain more carbohydrates, it lacks the diverse range of nutrients present in small grains. One of the standout features of these grains is their high fibre content, which plays a crucial role in preventing constipation and managing blood sugar levels and cholesterol. Regular consumption of high-fibre diets is also linked to lower risks of diabetes, high blood pressure, and certain cancers.

Fibre also aids in weight management. Foods like sorghum leave one feeling full faster and longer, helping to reduce overeating. For maximum benefit, it is recommended to consume whole, unrefined grains to retain the nutrient-rich seed coat. Furthermore, small grains are naturally gluten-free, making them an excellent choice for individuals with gluten sensitivities or celiac disease.

Once marginalized and overlooked, small grains are now reclaiming their rightful place at the center of healthy, sustainable eating. Their nutritional value, coupled with growing awareness of health and wellness, has transformed them from â€œpoor manâ€™s foodâ€ into a prized staple for those seeking a wholesome, traditional, and disease-preventing diet.

THOMAS MAZORODZE WEKWAGUTU is an entrepreneur and founder of THE HEALING BASKET. This article is based on his personal research and experience. He writes in his capacity as a researcher, entrepreneur,  His views are meant to inform and inspire, not to replace professional medical advice.

ingredients: 1. In a large bowl, combine the mashed potatoes, flour, baking powder, garlic powder, onion powder, dried parsley, salt. Mix well until all the ingredients are fully incorporated.
2. In a separate bowl, beat the egg and milk together. Pour the mixture into the potato mixture and stir until a thick batter forms.
3. Add the mixed vegetables into the batter and mix well.
4. In a large pan, heat vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
5. Using a spoon or ice cream scooper, drop spoonfuls of the potato and vegetable batter into the hot oil. Flatten the fritters slightly using the back of the spoon.
6. Fry the fritters for about 2-3 minutes on each side, or until they are golden brown and crispy.
7. Once cooked, remove the fritters from the pan and place them on a paper towel to absorb any excess oil.
8. Serve the hot with your choice of dipping sauce, such as ranch dressing or ketchup.
*These fritters are a great way to use up leftover mashed potatoes and add some extra veggies into your diet. They make a delicious and satisfying side dish.*

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen

ingredients: 1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the mashed potatoes, shredded cheddar cheese, and one beaten egg. Mix well until all ingredients are fully incorporated.
2. Season the mixture with salt to taste.
3. Take a small amount of the mixture and roll it into a bite-sized ball using your hands.
4. Roll the ball in bread crumbs, making sure it is evenly coated.
5. Repeat with the remaining mixture until all of it has been used up.
6. Heat vegetable oil in a deep fryer or a large pot over medium-high heat.
7. Once the oil is hot, carefully drop the potato bites into the oil using a slotted spoon.
8. Fry the bites for about 2-3 minutes, or until they are golden brown and crispy.
9. Use the slotted spoon to remove the bites from the oil and place them on a paper towel-lined plate to drain excess oil.
10. Serve the hot with your favorite dipping sauce, such as ranch or ketchup.

ingredients: 1. Preheat your oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit (190 degrees Celsius).
2. Cut the cauliflower into small florets and place them in a food processor. Pulse until the cauliflower resembles fine crumbs.
3. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cauliflower crumbs, almond flour, nutritional yeast, garlic powder, and salt.
4. Add in the olive oil and almond milk, and mix until a dough forms.
5. Roll out the dough onto a parchment-lined baking sheet, creating a round pizza shape.
6. In a small saucepan, heat the minced garlic and vegan cream cheese over medium heat until the cream cheese is melted and the garlic is fragrant.
7. Spread the creamy garlic sauce over the pizza crust.
8. Top the pizza with the diced red onion, sliced mushrooms, black olives, and bell peppers.
9. Bake the pizza in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, until the crust is golden brown.
10. Once the pizza is done baking, remove it from the oven and top it with fresh basil and a sprinkle of salt and pepper.
11. Let the pizza cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.
Enjoy your ! This delicious vegan twist on a classic pizza is sure to become a new favorite.ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹

ingredients: 1. Preheat your oven to 425 degrees Celsius.

2. In a pan over medium heat, sautÃ© the chickpeas, red bell pepper, and red onion with a drizzle of olive oil until slightly softened, about 5 minutes. Season with salt, pepper, oregano, basil, and garlic powder.
3. Roll out the pre-made vegan pizza crust on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
4. Spread the tomato sauce evenly over the crust, leaving a small border around the edges.
5. Top the sauce with the sautÃ©ed chickpea and vegetable mixture.
6. Add the black olives, cherry tomatoes, artichoke hearts, and sun-dried tomatoes on top of the vegetables.
7. Sprinkle the shredded vegan mozzarella cheese over the pizza.
8. Bake the pizza in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
9. Once done, remove the pizza from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
10. Top the pizza with fresh basil leaves and drizzle with a little more olive oil.
11. Cut the pizza into slices and serve immediately.

Enjoy your delicious and flavorful ! This vegan pizza is packed with protein and nutrients from the chickpeas and vegetables, making it a healthy and satisfying meal. The perfect option for a quick and easy dinner or a fun option for a pizza night with friends or family. Buon appetito!ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹

ingredients: 1. Preheat your oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit (200 degrees Celsius).

2. In a mixing bowl, combine the drained and pressed tofu, soy sauce, sesame oil, chili powder, garlic powder, onion powder, and ground ginger. Mix well until the tofu is evenly coated with the marinade.
3. Place the tofu on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and bake for 20 minutes, flipping halfway through.

4. While the tofu is baking, prepare the peanut sauce by combining the peanut butter, hoisin sauce, apple cider vinegar, and sriracha sauce in a small saucepan over low heat. Stir until the sauce is smooth and heated through.
5. Once the tofu is done baking, remove it from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes.
6. Spread the peanut sauce evenly over the pre-made pizza crust.
7. Cut the tofu into bite-sized pieces and evenly distribute them on top of the pizza.
8. Sprinkle the shredded carrots, chopped red bell pepper, green onions, and cilantro on top of the pizza.
9. Bake the pizza in the oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the crust is crispy and the vegetables are slightly roasted.
10. Once done, remove the pizza from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.
Enjoy your delicious and unique ! Optional: Drizzle with extra peanut sauce for added flavor.ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: Making gluten from scratch involves washing flour to remove the starch, leaving behind the gluten (the protein part). This process is often used in plant-based cooking to make seitan, a meat substitute. Hereâ€™s how you can do it:

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: - 1 kg (about 8 cups) of wheat flour (preferably high-gluten bread flour)
- Water (enough to form a dough and for rinsing)
- Place the flour in a large bowl.
- Gradually add water while mixing until a firm dough forms. Knead for about 10 minutes until smooth and elastic.
- Cover with water and let it rest for 30 minutes. This helps relax the gluten.
- Place the dough in a bowl of water and start kneading it gently under water. The water will become milky as the starch washes out.
- Pour out the starchy water and refill with clean water, repeating the kneading process.
- Keep washing and kneading until the water is almost clear, and youâ€™re left with a rubbery, stretchy massâ€”this is your gluten.
- Place the gluten in a strainer to remove excess water.
- Knead slightly to shape it as desired.
- Boil: Simmer in a seasoned broth for 45-60 minutes.
- Bake or Steam: You can also steam or bake it depending on the texture you prefer.
- Use cold water when washing to avoid the gluten becoming too sticky.
- For added flavor, you can mix spices or herbs into the dough before washing.
*To obtain gluten, flour is mixed with water and the starch is washed out. This process is completed commercially and a great deal of care is needed to maintain the baking quality of gluten.*

ingredients: 1. Soak the dried chickpeas in water overnight or for at least 8 hours. Drain and rinse before using.
2. In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the diced onion and minced garlic, and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add the soaked chickpeas to the pot along with the cumin, paprika, coriander, ginger, turmeric, cinnamon, and cayenne pepper. Stir to coat the chickpeas in the spices and cook for 2-3 minutes.
4. Pour in the diced tomatoes, vegetable broth, and water. Stir to combine and bring to a simmer. Cover the pot and let it cook for 1 hour, or until the chickpeas are tender.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 5. After 1 hour, add the frozen okra to the stew and season with salt and pepper to taste. Let it cook for an additional 10 minutes.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen

ingredients: 1. Rinse the okra and trim off the stems. Cut the okra into 1-inch pieces and set aside.
2. In a large pot, heat the coconut oil over medium-high heat. Add the onion and garlic and sautÃ© until translucent, about 2-3 minutes.
3. Add the diced red bell pepper to the pot and cook for another 2-3 minutes.

5. Pour in the vegetable soup and bring it to a simmer.
6. Add the okra to the pot and let it cook for about 8-10 minutes, until it is tender.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. In a large pot, combine the lentils and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and let simmer for 20 minutes. Drain and set aside.
2. In the same pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add cumin,coriander  and salt. Stir to combine and cook for 1-2 minutes.
4. Pour in diced tomatoes and vegetable broth, stir to combine, and bring to a simmer.
5. Add the cooked lentils and okra to the pot. Stir and let simmer for 20 minutes.
6. Serve hot, garnished with fresh parsley or cilantro, if desired.

*_Okra and Tomato Pasta with Caramelized Onion and Garlic Sauce_*

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. Begin by cooking the pasta according to package instructions in a large pot of salted boiling water. Once cooked, drain and set aside.
2. While the pasta is cooking, prepare the okra by washing and trimming off the stems. Cut them into bite-sized pieces.
3. In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat. Add the okra and cook for 5-7 minutes until slightly tender. Set aside.
4. In the same skillet, add another tablespoon of olive oil and the sliced onions. Cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the onions are caramelized and golden brown.
5. Add the minced garlic to the skillet with the onions and cook for an additional 2 minutes.
6. Next, add the cherry tomatoes to the skillet and cook for 5 minutes until they start to burst and release their juices.
7. Season the onion and tomato mixture with salt and pepper to taste.
8. Add the cooked pasta and okra to the skillet and toss everything together until well combined.
9. Let the pasta cook for an additional 2-3 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
10. Serve the hot, garnished with some fresh herbs or grated parmesan cheese if desired.
*_Okra and Tomato ğŸ… ğŸ… ğŸ… with Onion ğŸ§…ğŸ§…ğŸ§…_*

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. Begin by heating olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add diced onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
2. Cut the okra into 1-inch pieces and add them to the pot. Cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
3. Add in the seasoning and stir until the okra is evenly coated.
4. Cut the tomatoes into small chunks and add them to the pot. Cook for an additional 5 minutes.
5. Cut the onion  into bite-sized pieces and add them to the pot. Cook.
6. Pour in the vegetable broth and stir well. Season with salt to taste.
7. Increase the heat to high and bring the mixture to a boil. Once boiling, reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
8. Serve hot, garnished with fresh parsley if desired.

This is a delicious and hearty meal. The combination of tender okra, juicy tomatoes, and flavorful seasoning, along with the savory onion, creates a dish that is bursting with flavor. Serve it as a main course or as a side dish to your favorite protein.
Enjoy the taste of this easy recipe!ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹
*_Tomato and Okra Gumbo with SautÃ©ed Onions_*

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. Begin by preparing all the vegetables. Wash and cut the okra into 1-inch pieces, dice the tomatoes, and slice the onions.
2. In a large pot, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the sliced onions and sautÃ© for 3-4 minutes until they start to become translucent.
3. Add the diced tomatoes to the pot and stir. Let it cook for 5 minutes until the tomatoes start to break down and become sauce-like.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 4. Add the okra to the pot and season with salt, black pepper, garlic powder, dried thyme, dried oregano, and bay leaf. Stir to combine all the ingredients.
5. Pour the vegetable broth over the vegetables and bring the mixture to a boil. Once boiling, reduce the heat to medium and let it simmer for 20 minutes.

6. While the gumbo is simmering, prepare the sautÃ©ed onions. Heat the remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the remaining sliced onions and cook for 5-6 minutes until they are caramelized and golden brown.
7. Once the gumbo has finished simmering, remove the bay leaf and check for seasoning. Adjust if needed.
8. To serve, ladle the gumbo into bowls and top with the sautÃ©ed onions.
Enjoy your delicious , a hearty and flavorful dish that is perfect for any occasion.ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹
*_Spicy Okra and Tomato Curry with Caramelized Onions_*

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: - tip of a teaspoon of cayenne pepper

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. Begin by washing and drying 500 grams of okra. Remove the tops and tips of the okra and cut them into 1-inch pieces.

2. Heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the okra and cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until they start to brown. Remove the okra from the pan and set aside.
3. In the same pan, add 2 large sliced onions and cook on low heat for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until they are caramelized.
4. While the onions are caramelizing, chop 400 grams of tomatoes into small pieces. Crush 2 cloves of garlic and grate 1 tablespoon of ginger.
5. Once the onions are caramelized, add the garlic and ginger to the pan and cook for 1-2 minutes.
6. Add the chopped tomatoes to the pan and cook for 5-7 minutes until they start to break down.
7. Add 1 teaspoon each of cumin, coriander, turmeric, and cayenne pepper to the pan and mix well.
8. Return the okra to the pan and stir everything together. Add salt to taste.
9. Cover the pan and let the curry simmer for 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the okra is tender.
10. Once the okra is cooked, remove the lid and let the curry cook for an additional 5 minutes to thicken.
11. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve.
Enjoy the delicious and flavorful combination of spicy okra and sweet caramelized onions!ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: *_Okra and Tomato Stew with Caramelized Onions_*

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. Begin by preparing the okra. Wash and dry the okra pods, then trim off the tops and tails. Cut the okra into 1 inch pieces and set aside.
2. In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the onions and cook until they are caramelized, about 10-12 minutes. Stir occasionally to prevent burning.
3. Once the onions are caramelized, add the minced garlic and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
4. Add the okra to the pot and stir to combine with the onions and garlic. Cook for 5-7 minutes, until the okra begins to soften.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 5. Add the tomatoes to the pot, along with the cumin, dried thyme, dried oregano, salt. Stir to combine all the ingredients.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 6. Pour in 1 cup of water and bring the stew to a boil. Once boiling, reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and let it simmer for 15-20 minutes.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 7. Check the stew occasionally and stir to prevent it from sticking to the bottom of the pot. If the stew is too thick, you can add more water as needed.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 8. Once the okra is tender and the stew has thickened, you can serve it hot, garnished with fresh parsley if desired.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: This is a delicious and hearty dish that is perfect for any season. The combination of the okra and tomatoes creates a flavorful base, while the caramelized onions add a touch of sweetness. Serve this stew for a satisfying meal.

ingredients: 1. Peel and chop the sweet potatoes into small cubes.

4. Add the cooked sweet potatoes to the groundnut mixture and mash them with a potato masher until well incorporated.

6. Remove from heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
7. Serve the warm in bowls. Top with additional shredded coconut and chopped almonds, if desired.

ingredients: Can I also have gluten preparations and cooking methods

Making gluten from scratch involves washing flour to remove the starch, leaving behind the gluten (the protein part). This process is often used in plant-based cooking to make seitan, a meat substitute. Hereâ€™s how you can do it:

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: - 1 kg (about 8 cups) of wheat flour (preferably high-gluten bread flour)
- Water (enough to form a dough and for rinsing)
- Place the flour in a large bowl.
- Gradually add water while mixing until a firm dough forms. Knead for about 10 minutes until smooth and elastic.
- Cover with water and let it rest for 30 minutes. This helps relax the gluten.
- Place the dough in a bowl of water and start kneading it gently under water. The water will become milky as the starch washes out.
- Pour out the starchy water and refill with clean water, repeating the kneading process.
- Keep washing and kneading until the water is almost clear, and youâ€™re left with a rubbery, stretchy massâ€”this is your gluten.
- Place the gluten in a strainer to remove excess water.
- Knead slightly to shape it as desired.
- Boil: Simmer in a seasoned broth for 45-60 minutes.
- Bake or Steam: You can also steam or bake it depending on the texture you prefer.
- Use cold water when washing to avoid the gluten becoming too sticky.
- For added flavor, you can mix spices or herbs into the dough before washing.
*To obtain gluten, flour is mixed with water and the starch is washed out. This process is completed commercially and a great deal of care is needed to maintain the baking quality of gluten.*

3. In a bowl, mix the mayonnaise,  salt.

5. Add the parsley and mix until combined.
6. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. Peel the cassava and cut it into small cubes. Place the cassava cubes in a pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil and let it cook for 15 minutes.
2. While the cassava is cooking, chop the tomatoes and onion into small pieces. Set aside.

3. Drain the cassava and mash it in a bowl until it becomes a smooth paste. Add in the chopped tomatoes and onion, along with the salt,  olive oil, parsley, cilantro, garlic powder, onion powder, cumin. Mix well.
4. In a separate bowl, beat the egg and milk together. Gradually add in the flour, stirring until a smooth batter forms.

5. Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat and add a small amount of oil. Once hot, scoop about 1/4 cup of the cassava mixture onto the pan and flatten it into a pancake shape. Repeat with the remaining mixture, leaving enough space between each pancake.
6. Cook the pancakes for about 3-4 minutes on each side, or until they turn golden brown and crispy.
7. Remove the pancakes from the pan and place them on a paper towel-lined plate to absorb any excess oil.
8. Serve the warm, topped with your favorite condiments such as sour cream or salsa.

Enjoy your delicious and unique twist on traditional pancakes with the added flavor and nutrition of cassava, tomato, and onion. These pancakes are perfect for breakfast, brunch, or even as a savory snack.ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹

ingredients: 1. Begin by preparing the vegetables. Chop the potatoes into bite-sized pieces. Rinse the peas and set aside.
2. In a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat. Add in the cumin seeds and let them sizzle for a few seconds.
3. Add in the diced onion, minced garlic, grated ginger. SautÃ© for 2-3 minutes until the onions are translucent.
4. Next, add in the chopped potatoes and stir to coat them in the onion and spice mixture. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
5. Add in the coriander powder, turmeric powder and salt. Stir to combine and cook for another 2 minutes.
6. Pour in 1 cup of water and bring to a boil. Once boiling, reduce the heat to low and let simmer for 15 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender.
7. Add in the peas and cook for an additional 5 minutes.
8. Taste and adjust the seasoning to your liking.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. In a large pot, combine the lentils and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and let simmer for 20 minutes. Drain and set aside.
2. In the same pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
3. Add cumin,coriander  and salt. Stir to combine and cook for 1-2 minutes.
4. Pour in diced tomatoes and vegetable broth, stir to combine, and bring to a simmer.
5. Add the cooked lentils and okra to the pot. Stir and let simmer for 20 minutes.
6. Serve hot, garnished with fresh parsley or cilantro, if desired.

Chefs help me how do we cook eggplant and potatoes for diabetic person

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: *_Cooking eggplant for a diabetic person involves choosing methods that help manage blood sugar levels and retain nutrients. Here are some tips:_*

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: - *Grilling or Roasting*: These methods bring out the natural sweetness in eggplant without adding extra sugars.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: - *Baking*: Baking eggplant is a low-fat cooking method that helps retain nutrients.
- *Stir-Frying*: Quickly stir-frying eggplant with minimal oil can help preserve its nutrients and flavor.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: - *Steaming*: Steaming eggplant is a low-calorie cooking method that helps retain its nutrients.
*When cooking eggplant for a diabetic person, consider the following:*
- *Portion Control*: Monitor portion sizes to manage carbohydrate intake.
- *Pair with Protein and Healthy Fats*: Combining eggplant with protein sources like beans, or nuts, and healthy fats like olive oil, can help regulate blood sugar levels.
- *Choose Low-Carb Seasonings*: Opt for herbs and spices instead of sugary sauces or high-carb seasonings.
*Some delicious and diabetes-friendly eggplant recipes include:*
- *Grilled Eggplant with Herbs*: Marinate eggplant slices in olive oil, garlic, and herbs, then grill until tender.
- *Roasted Eggplant with Vegetables*: Roast eggplant with other vegetables like tomatoes, bell peppers, and zucchini, seasoned with salt, pepper, and herbs.
- *Eggplant Stir-Fry with Lean Protein*: Stir-fry eggplant with lean protein sources like tofu, and add healthy fats like nuts or seeds.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: *_Cooking potatoes for a diabetic person involves choosing methods that help manage blood sugar levels and retain nutrients. Here are some tips:_*

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: - *Baking or Roasting*: These methods help retain more nutrients and fiber compared to boiling or frying.
- *Boiling*: Boiling potatoes can be a good option if you discard the cooking water, which contains some of the starch.
- *Grilling*: Grilling potatoes can add flavor without adding extra carbohydrates.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: - *Mashing with Healthy Ingredients*: Mash potatoes with healthy fats like olive oil or avocado, and add some protein sources like Greek yogurt or beans.
*_When cooking potatoes for a diabetic person, consider the following:_*
- *Choose Complex Carbohydrates*: Opt for complex carbohydrates like sweet potatoes or choose potatoes with a lower glycemic index.
- *Portion Control*: Monitor portion sizes to manage carbohydrate intake.
- *Pair with Protein and Healthy Fats*: Combining potatoes with protein sources like beans, or nuts, and healthy fats like olive oil, can help regulate blood sugar levels.
- *Avoid High-Carb Toppings*: Limit or avoid high-carb toppings like butter, sour cream, or cheese.
*Some delicious and diabetes-friendly potato recipes include:*
- *Baked Sweet Potato*: Bake sweet potatoes in the oven with a drizzle of olive oil and a sprinkle of cinnamon.
- *Roasted Potatoes with Herbs*: Roast diced potatoes with herbs like rosemary or thyme, and a drizzle of olive oil.
- *Grilled Potato Wedges*: Grill potato wedges with a sprinkle of salt and pepper, and serve with a side of lean protein.

ingredients: 1. Wash the eggplant and cut into small cubes.

3. Cook the eggplant cubes for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally until they are lightly browned.
4. Crack the eggs into a bowl, whisk until combined and season with salt.
5. Add the eggs to the pan with the eggplant cubes and stir to combine.
6. Cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the eggs are cooked through.
7. Serve with a side of your favorite vegetables, or enjoy as is.

ingredients: 1. _Baking: Replace refined sugar with date sugar in recipes for cakes, cookies, and muffins._
2. *Desserts: Use date sugar in puddings, custards, and ice cream.*
3. _Beverages: Sweeten coffee, tea, or smoothies with date sugar._
4. *_Sauces and marinades: Add date sugar to BBQ sauces, teriyaki sauces, or marinades for a rich flavor._*
5. *Granola and energy bars: Mix date sugar with nuts and seeds for a healthy snack.*
6. _Yogurt and oatmeal: Sprinkle date sugar on top for added sweetness._
7. *Ice cream and frozen yogurt: Use date sugar as a topping or mix-in.*
8. _Sauces and syrups: Make date syrup by dissolving date sugar in water for a natural sweetener._

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: To create a superb side of soft, caramelized roasted mushrooms, use simple, simple ingredients.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: And we're here to demonstrate it! When mushrooms are oven-roasted at high temperatures for a brief period of time, the water is able to escape, leaving behind soft, melt-in-your-mouth interiors and golden-brown caramelized exteriors. You'll find earthy, meaty, herbaceous, and crave-worthy bits of flavor in this recipe for roasted mushrooms. They just require eight ingredients and are quick, simple, and extremely tasty. These are vegan and paleo-friendly, making them the ideal savory side for all dietary requirements! We also enjoy dry-sautÃ© mushrooms, even though roasting them is the simplest way to prepare them and intensify their flavor.
Are Roasted Mushrooms Good For You?

Oven roasted mushrooms are super underrated! Not only are they earthy, savory, and meaty but also are packed with nutrients! Roasted mushrooms in the oven are generally low in calories and fat and are great to bulk up a meal. They contain Vitamin D, riboflavin, potassium and are a good source of fiber! Some experts even say that roast mushrooms can help boost your immune system, have anti-cancer properties, and lower your blood pressure due to their antioxidants!
How Do You Keep Mushrooms From Getting Soggy In The Oven?

â€¦is one of the most common questions we get asked! No one likes soggy, slimy mushrooms and so weâ€™re here to give you all the tips and tricks, for tender, flavorful mushrooms oven roasted with toasty, crispy exteriors:
Gently clean your mushrooms with a paper towel rather than running them under cold water.

Since mushrooms are a high water content food, meaning that their sponge-like structure allows for water to be released during cooking, we recommend that if juices pool halfway through baking, drain them off the tray so they continue to roast instead of steam.
When in doubt, salt after, prevents the water from being released more rapidly during cooking.
Oven-roasted mushrooms can go with just about any dish: theyâ€™re extremely versatile, light yet still hearty!

Sprinkle them over our Creamy Mashed Potatoes and Green Bean Almondine. Add them to Alfredo Sauce or Homemade Marinara to bulk up the sauce. They also go great with pasta such as Vegan Cauliflower Gnocchi, Sausage Kale Pasta with Lemon Cream Sauce, or Creamy Roasted Red Pepper Pasta. There are so many ways to devour roasted mushrooms but our favorite way is straight from the baking sheet.
Follow our step-by-step instructions below for perfectly crispy outsides and tender insides each and every time:

Prep! For our roasted mushrooms recipe, we use cremini mushrooms but you can make it your own and roast portobello, shiitake, or button mushrooms â€“ whatever you have available! Cut into quarters and drizzle with olive oil and salt! Pro tip: place them cut-side down in a single layer to get that crispy bottom!

Cook! Youâ€™ll do this in two iterations at 450Â°F. First, cook them for 10 minutes. They might start to release some water so now is a great time to remove the liquid from the rimmed baking sheet. Add in the garlic and thyme halfway through so it doesnâ€™t burn! Toss them and then return them to a single layer, preferably on the other cut side for optimal golden-brown color!
Garnish with fresh parsley and enjoy! Roast mushrooms will become caramelized on the outside and soft on the inside!
Tools Youâ€™ll Need For Roasted Mushrooms

ingredients: Place the mushrooms on a rimmed sheet pan. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Toss to coat.

Spread the mushrooms out in a single layer and bake for 10 minutes. Remove from the oven, add the garlic and thyme and toss to combine. Place back in the oven and continue to cook until the mushrooms are caramelized and soft, about 10 more minutes.
Remove from the oven and toss with parsley before serving.

1. *Heat the soya milk ğŸ¥›ğŸ¥›ğŸ¥›*: Heat the soya milk ğŸ¥› ğŸ¥› ğŸ¥› to 180Â°F (82Â°C) to denature the proteins and create a creamy texture.

3. *Add the starter culture*: Whisk in the soya yogurt starter culture or active dry yogurt culture.
4. *Incubate*: Pour the mixture into a clean glass jar or container and incubate it at a warm temperature (around 100Â°F/38Â°C) for 6 to 8 hours or overnight.
5. *Chill*: Once the yogurt has set, refrigerate it to chill and set further.

ingredients: 1. In a large bowl, combine the mashed potatoes, flour, baking powder, garlic powder, onion powder, dried parsley, salt. Mix well until all the ingredients are fully incorporated.
2. In a separate bowl, beat the egg and milk together. Pour the mixture into the potato mixture and stir until a thick batter forms.
3. Add the mixed vegetables into the batter and mix well.
4. In a large pan, heat vegetable oil over medium-high heat.
5. Using a spoon or ice cream scooper, drop spoonfuls of the potato and vegetable batter into the hot oil. Flatten the fritters slightly using the back of the spoon.
6. Fry the fritters for about 2-3 minutes on each side, or until they are golden brown and crispy.
7. Once cooked, remove the fritters from the pan and place them on a paper towel to absorb any excess oil.
8. Serve the hot with your choice of dipping sauce, such as ranch dressing or ketchup.
*These fritters are a great way to use up leftover mashed potatoes and add some extra veggies into your diet. They make a delicious and satisfying side dish.*

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen

ingredients: 1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the mashed potatoes, shredded cheddar cheese, and one beaten egg. Mix well until all ingredients are fully incorporated.
2. Season the mixture with salt to taste.
3. Take a small amount of the mixture and roll it into a bite-sized ball using your hands.
4. Roll the ball in bread crumbs, making sure it is evenly coated.
5. Repeat with the remaining mixture until all of it has been used up.
6. Heat vegetable oil in a deep fryer or a large pot over medium-high heat.
7. Once the oil is hot, carefully drop the potato bites into the oil using a slotted spoon.
8. Fry the bites for about 2-3 minutes, or until they are golden brown and crispy.
9. Use the slotted spoon to remove the bites from the oil and place them on a paper towel-lined plate to drain excess oil.
10. Serve the hot with your favorite dipping sauce, such as ranch or ketchup.
*_Creamy Mashed Potatoes with Garlic and Herbs_*

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: - 1 kg potatoes, peeled and cut into small chunks
- 1 cup of plant based milk (soya milk ğŸ¥› ğŸ¥› ğŸ¥›)

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. In a large pot, add the potatoes and enough water to cover them. Bring to a boil over high heat and cook for about 15 minutes or until the potatoes are fork-tender.
2. Drain the potatoes and return them to the pot. Using a potato masher or fork, mash the potatoes until they are smooth and creamy.
3. In a small saucepan, heat the milk and minced garlic over medium heat until it starts to simmer.
4. Pour the hot milk and garlic mixture over the mashed potatoes and stir until well combined.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 5. Add chopped herbs, salt, to the potatoes and mix until all the ingredients are evenly distributed.
6. For a creamier texture, you can use an electric hand mixer to blend the potatoes until they reach your desired consistency.
7. Serve the hot, garnished with extra chopped herbs on top for added flavor and presentation.

*Enjoy your delicious and flavorful as a side dish for any meal. This dish pairs perfectly with roasted meats, grilled vegetables, or can even be enjoyed on its own. You can also adjust the amount of garlic and herbs according to your personal taste preference.ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹*

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the diced onion and cook until translucent, about 3 minutes.
2. Add the minced garlic and sliced mushrooms to the pot. Cook for 5 minutes, until the mushrooms have softened.
3. Add the quinoa to the pot and stir to combine with the mushrooms. Toast the quinoa for 2-3 minutes, until it starts to lightly brown.
4. Slowly pour in the vegetable broth, stirring constantly. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for 15 minutes.
5. After 15 minutes, add the chopped spinach to the pot. Stir to combine and let it continue to cook for another 5 minutes.
6. Check the quinoa for doneness. If it is still slightly crunchy, add a little more vegetable broth and continue to cook for a few more minutes.
7. Once the quinoa is fully cooked and the liquid has been absorbed, remove the pot from the heat.
8. Stir in the grated Parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper, to taste.
9. Transfer the risotto to a serving dish and garnish with fresh parsley, if desired.

10. Serve hot and enjoy your delicious ! This dish is packed with protein, fiber, and nutrients from the quinoa, mushrooms, and spinach. It's a perfect vegetarian meal that is both healthy and satisfying.
*_Savory Spinach and Feta Crepes using Whole Wheat Flour_*

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. In a large mixing bowl, combine the whole wheat flour, eggs, milk, melted butter and a pinch of salt. Whisk until well combined and smooth. Let the batter rest for 10 minutes.
2. In a non-stick pan, heat a small amount of olive oil over medium heat.
3. Wash the spinach thoroughly and remove any tough stems. Chop the spinach into small pieces.
4. Once the pan is hot, pour a ladle full of the crepe batter and swirl it around to cover the bottom of the pan. Cook for about 1-2 minutes until the edges start to brown.
5. Sprinkle a handful of chopped spinach on one half of the crepe and crumble some feta cheese on top.
6. Using a spatula, fold the other half of the crepe over the spinach and feta filling, creating a half-moon shape. Press down lightly with the spatula to seal the edges.
7. Cook for another 1-2 minutes until the bottom is golden brown.
8. Carefully flip the crepe over and cook for another minute until the other side is also golden brown.
9. Repeat the process with the remaining batter and filling, adding more oil to the pan as needed.
10. Serve the savory spinach and feta crepes hot.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 2. Heat the olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the spinach leaves, mushrooms, garlic, salt, and pepper. Cook for 5-7 minutes.
3. In a small bowl, mix together the ricotta, Parmesan, and parsley.
4. Spread 1/2 cup of the tomato sauce in the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish.
5. Arrange 4 lasagna noodles over the sauce.
6. Spread 1/2 of the spinach and mushroom mixture over the noodles.
7. Top with 1/2 of the ricotta mixture.
8. Drizzle 1/2 cup of tomato sauce over the ricotta.
9. Sprinkle 1/2 cup of mozzarella cheese over the tomato sauce.
10. Repeat layers of noodles, spinach and mushroom mixture, ricotta, tomato sauce, and mozzarella cheese.
11. Top with the remaining 4 noodles and remaining tomato sauce.
12. Cover with foil and bake for 35 minutes.
13. Remove foil and bake for an additional 10 minutes.

> Here are some nutritious and kid-friendly vegetarian lunch ideas suitable for preschoolers:
- Veggie sandwiches with avocado, cheese, and veggies like cucumber, carrots, and bell peppers.
- Hummus and veggie sandwiches with cucumber, carrots, and sprouts.
- Whole wheat wraps with hummus, shredded veggies, and cheese.
- Veggie sticks with hummus or guacamole dip.
- Fresh fruit like grapes, berries, or sliced apples.
- Mini whole wheat pitas with hummus and veggies.
- Veggie spring rolls with peanut sauce.
- Mini naan bread with hummus and cucumber slices.
*_Some tips for packing lunches for preschoolers:_*
- *Use fun containers*: Bento boxes or colorful containers can make mealtime more engaging.
- *Include a variety of foods*: Offer a mix of protein, healthy fats, and complex carbohydrates.
- *Make it interactive*: Include foods that can be dipped or assembled, like veggie sticks with hummus.
- *Consider food safety*: Pack lunches in insulated bags with ice packs if needed, and choose foods that can be safely stored at room temperature.

*_Pak choi (also known as bok choy) is a delicious and versatile Asian green. Here are some tasty recipe ideas:_*
- *Stir-Fried Pak Choi*: Stir-fry pak choi with garlic, ginger, and your choice of protein ( tofu) in a savory sauce.
- *Steamed Pak Choi*: Steam pak choi with garlic and ginger for a simple and healthy side dish.
- *Pak Choi Soup*: Add pak choi to soups like wonton soup or noodle soup for added nutrition and flavor.
- *Grilled Pak Choi*: Brush pak choi with olive oil and grill until tender and slightly charred.
- *Pak Choi Stir-Fry with Mushrooms*: Stir-fry pak choi and mushrooms with soy sauce and sesame oil for a flavorful and earthy dish.
*_Some general tips for cooking pak choi:_*
- *Use both stems and leaves*: Pak choi is edible from stem to leaf, so don't discard any parts.
- *Cook briefly*: Pak choi cooks quickly, so stir-fry or steam it briefly to preserve its texture and nutrients.
- *Pair with Asian flavors*: Pak choi pairs well with Asian flavors like soy sauce, ginger, and sesame oil.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. Peel the cassava and cut it into small cubes. Place the cassava cubes in a pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil and let it cook for 15 minutes.
2. While the cassava is cooking, chop the tomatoes and onion into small pieces. Set aside.

3. Drain the cassava and mash it in a bowl until it becomes a smooth paste. Add in the chopped tomatoes and onion, along with the salt,  olive oil, parsley, cilantro, garlic powder, onion powder, cumin. Mix well.
4. In a separate bowl, beat the egg and milk together. Gradually add in the flour, stirring until a smooth batter forms.

5. Heat a non-stick pan over medium heat and add a small amount of oil. Once hot, scoop about 1/4 cup of the cassava mixture onto the pan and flatten it into a pancake shape. Repeat with the remaining mixture, leaving enough space between each pancake.
6. Cook the pancakes for about 3-4 minutes on each side, or until they turn golden brown and crispy.
7. Remove the pancakes from the pan and place them on a paper towel-lined plate to absorb any excess oil.
8. Serve the warm, topped with your favorite condiments such as sour cream or salsa.

Enjoy your delicious and unique twist on traditional pancakes with the added flavor and nutrition of cassava, tomato, and onion. These pancakes are perfect for breakfast, brunch, or even as a savory snack.ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹

ingredients: 1. Mash the bananas in a large bowl.
2. Break the eggs into the mashed banana and mix them together.
3. Add the self-raising flour, milk or plant based milk, vegetable oil, sweetener and vanilla extract to the mix and stir until combined.
4. Heat a non-stick pan over medium-high heat and add a tablespoon of vegetable oil.
5. When the oil is hot, spoon the batter onto the pan and cook for 2-3 minutes.
6. Flip the pancakes and cook for a further 2 minutes until golden brown.
7. Serve with your favourite toppings and enjoy!ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: Prepare flax egg in a bowl by mixing flax seed meal with water.
SautÃ© minced garlic with a tbsp of olive oil in a skillet until slightly browned. Cool slightly and add to the bowl with flax egg.

Form into balls - about 12 in total. Then roll in additional bread crumbs.

Put meatballs on a bare baking sheet and transfer to the preheated oven (375F/190C) and bake for 15 minutes.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. In a large skillet, heat 1 tbsp of olive oil over medium heat. Add 1 diced onion and 2 minced garlic cloves and cook until softened, about 2-3 minutes.
2. Add 200g of soya mince to the skillet and cook for about 5 minutes, until browned.
3. Add 1 tsp of cumin, and 1 tsp of dried oregano to the skillet and stir to combine.
4. Drain and rinse 200g of lentils and add them to the skillet. Stir to combine with the soya mince mixture.
5. Pour 1 can of diced tomatoes into the skillet and stir. Let the mixture simmer for 10 minutes, until the liquid has reduced and the lentils are tender.
6. While the mixture is simmering, heat up the tortillas according to package instructions.
7. To assemble the tacos, place a scoop of the soya mince and lentil mixture onto a tortilla. Add desired toppings such as shredded cheese, avocado, salsa, and sour cream.
8. Serve immediately and enjoy your delicious meal !ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹

*Tortilla, round, thin, flat bread of Mexico made from unleavened cornmeal or, less commonly, wheat flour. Traditionally, the corn (maize) for tortillas was boiled with unslaked lime to soften the kernels and loosen the hulls. (This lime was the principal source of calcium in the Mexican diet.)*

ingredients: 1. Wash the eggplant and cut into small cubes.

5. Add the eggs to the pan with the eggplant cubes and stir to combine.
6. Cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the eggs are cooked through.
7. Serve with a side of your favorite vegetables, or enjoy as is.

Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. Dice the potatoes into small cubes, about 1cm in size. Peel and dice the butternut into similar-sized cubes.

2. In a large skillet, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil over medium heat. Add the diced potatoes and butternut to the skillet and season with salt, garlic powder, and onion powder. Stir to evenly coat the vegetables with the seasoning.
3. Cook the potatoes and butternut for about 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until they are tender and crispy.
4. While the vegetables are cooking, dice the red bell pepper and yellow onion. Mince the garlic cloves and set aside.
5. In a separate skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat. Add the diced bell pepper, onion, and minced garlic. Cook for about 5 minutes until the vegetables are softened.
6. Once the potatoes and butternut are crispy, add them to the skillet with the bell pepper, onion, and garlic. Stir to combine all the vegetables.
7. Add dried thyme and rosemary to the skillet and continue to cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
8. Let the hash cook for another 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until all the vegetables are crispy and golden brown.
9. Serve the as a side dish or add some protein, to make it a complete meal.

ingredients: 1. In a medium saucepan, combine the groundnut butter, coconut milk, water, rolled oats, banana slices, honey, chia seeds, ground cinnamon, and vanilla extract. Stir well to combine.
2. Place the saucepan over medium heat and bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce heat to low and let the porridge simmer for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally.
3. While the porridge is simmering, preheat a small non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add the shredded coconut and toast for 2-3 minutes until golden brown. Set aside.
4. Once the porridge is cooked and thickened to your desired consistency, remove from heat and let it cool for a few minutes.
5. Transfer the porridge to a serving bowl and top with the toasted coconut.

_Enjoy your hot, or let it cool down and refrigerate for a yummy breakfast the next day. You can also add additional toppings such as fresh fruit, nuts, or a drizzle of extra honey for added sweetness._

*This creamy and delicious porridge bowl is a perfect blend of African and tropical flavors, making it a unique and flavorful breakfast option. The groundnut butter adds protein and healthy fats, while the coconut milk adds a rich and creamy texture. This recipe can be easily adjusted to your liking by adding more or less water depending on how thick you prefer your porridge. So next time you're craving a warm and comforting breakfast, give this a try!ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹*
*_Mango Coconut Overnight Oats with Vegan Yogurt_*

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen

- Optional toppings: sliced almonds, extra diced mango, and honey (or maple syrup) for sweetness.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 1. In a medium-sized bowl, mix together the rolled oats, coconut milk, and vegan yogurt until well combined.

recipes.name: Welcome to Healthy By Nature (HBN) vegetarian kitchen
ingredients: 2. Add in the diced mango, chia seeds, and shredded coconut. Stir well to evenly distribute all the ingredients.
3. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap or transfer the mixture into an airtight container.
4. Place the bowl or container in the refrigerator and let the oats soak overnight, or for at least 6-8 hours.
5. In the morning, give the oats a quick stir. If the mixture is too thick, you can add more coconut milk or water to achieve your desired consistency.
6. Transfer the oat mixture into serving bowls or jars. Top with sliced almonds, extra diced mango, and a drizzle of honey (or maple syrup) for sweetness.
Enjoy your delicious and nutritious for a quick and easy breakfast or snack option.
- You can use any type of vegan yogurt for this recipe, such as almond or coconut yogurt.
- If you prefer a sweeter taste, you can add a bit more honey or maple syrup to the oats before soaking overnight.
- The chia seeds and shredded coconut add extra fiber and healthy fats, but you can omit them if desired.
- For a tropical twist, you can also add some diced pineapple or banana to the oats.
- This recipe can be easily doubled or tripled to make multiple servings for meal prep.
- You can also use frozen mango if fresh is not available, just make sure to let it thaw before adding it to the oat mixture.ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹
